This is the perfect game if you're combing through the hundreds of games in your Steam library and aren't sure what to play. You can knock it out in an afternoon and enjoy yourself doing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998455537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 809, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1595521097}
review:
Chronology is a puzzle platformer, where you play with time, alternating between the past and present to stop the Verve. The objective is simple, stop your Mentor before he destroys the world.

Gameplay-wise, best with controller. You alternate between the past and present using O. Along the way, you will magically chance upon a snail companion 

The Snail can stick to surfaces and is immune to all damage. It also has the power to stop time.

Conclusion,

author: {'steamid': '76561198859617765', 'num_games_owned': 3676, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1596022337}
review:
如果你和我一樣進入遊戲後完全沒有聲音，並且隨意點擊畫面中任一選項就閃退。那麼你得去網路上找openal32.dll檔，然後放入遊戲安裝資料夾中，這樣遊戲才能順利執行。不過過場時讀取有時會卡住一小段時間。

遊戲特色是採切換時空通關的方式，這樣的主題在當年應該算很新穎，整體來說都還行，音樂也不錯，關卡難度及人物間的互動還算有趣。只能給中評。但若能修正第一段所述之問題，會讓遊戲體驗稍好一些。

本想給差評，但考量這是很舊的遊戲，加上打折後的價格，不能要求太高。

author: {'steamid': '76561197972311940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1594840215}
review: Chronology is a short but sweet platformer with a fun, unique twist. With beautifully drawn backgrounds and creatures to back it up, this game is well worth the couple of dollars. The puzzles start out pretty straightforward, but get increasingly difficult toward the end. I had to look up the solutions of couple of times, admittedly. You're looking at about 2 hours of gameplay in one run, so it makes a perfect time-killer when you want something that doesn't involve too much mental investment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048902826', 'num_games_owned': 1426, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1594502398}
review: Chronology is a cute, short puzzle platformer about an old man, a talking snail, and their time manipulation powers. The snail and the old man have different powers, such as the snail freezing time and the old man traveling between past and future, and the game uses these different powers to clever effect in creating the puzzles. Don't expect a grand epic or anything, it's quite short, but it's fun while it lasts. I was pleasantly surprised that the characters are all voice acted, not something I expect from an indie platformer. If you like Amanita Design's games or Braid, you should check out Chronology.

author: {'steamid': '76561198399977310', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1594497984}
review: Puzzle game indie molto ben fatto, dal gameplay stimolante, e graficamente molto piacevole. Forse un pelino troppo corto anche per la media delle piccole produzioni indie, anche se più che altro è l'ultimo capitolo ad essere davvero brevissimo, cosa che fa sì che il finale sia percepito come sbrigativo. Ma a parte ciò Chronology è un ottimo passatempo, stimola l'ingegno, gratifica la vista e i personaggi sanno regalare un paio di sani sorrisi, quindi lo consiglio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130173063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1592084626}
review:
Un plataforma con puzzles sencillo y corto.

No es gran cosa ni reinventa nada, pero te ayuda a relajarte luego de algun juego ultra denso.

5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027275508', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1589572318}
review:
Jednohubka na max 1,5h. 
Příběh je jednoduchý, stejně jako gameplay a více méně i grafika. Vyloženě ničím neurazí. 

Jediné co mě opravdu trápilo byly dlouhé načítací časy, ty byly opravdu nesmyslně dlouhé a bez zjevné příčiny, protože nic v pc nebylo vytížené. Napadá mě jen ta samá prkotina jako u Fallout 4, brzda byl lock 60 FPS monitoru.

author: {'steamid': '76561198991847738', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1590274391}
review:
O jogo é bem curto, mas é bem dinâmico, a historia é boa e a movimentação do jogo é ok. O jogo em si é muito bom e tem legenda PT-BR (Coisa que pra mim que não manja dos inglês é um ponto importante).

Recomendo sim comprar o jogo, mas pelas horas de gameplay aconselho esperar uma promoção e pegar ele por R$ 2,00 (foi o que eu fiz!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198408768447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1589407006}
review:
Chronology is a short but sweet and fun puzzle platformer with really nice graphics. Takes between 2 and 3 hours to complete, with only a couple of puzzles towards the end becoming more complicated and requiring deeper thinking. The main game mechanic is that you can swap between 'past' and 'present', with things you do in the 'past' having effects in the 'present'. None of the solutions to the puzzles are too farfetched or annoyingly convoluted.
The game is recommended for those of you looking for some casual puzzle solving with mild platforming challenges added to the mix in a beautiful colorful world with funny loveable characters. Main criticisms of the game would be its rather short length and lack of a real mental challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059825119', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1589396228}
review:
Frankly, I expected more from this game, having previously read the very positive steam reviews. 
I liked the concept of solving puzzles by time traveling, which changes the environment around you. 
But, I didn't find the game quite fun. It gets kinda boring quickly, and when you lose concentration, you get frustrated by a few puzzles which are far fetched. They can be solved only in 1 specific way. 
I presume it helps to play this game not at once, but bit by bit, over a few days. 
I liked the hand drawn graphics. 
It is too short and it lacks variety and content. 
If you want to buy, do that only when on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198238381548', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1588861633}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973241201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1588630847}
review:
Giochino simpatico che merita.
A prezzo pieno offre davvero poco, ma se lo trovate con un forte sconto, allora vi saprà piacevolmente intrattenere per un paio d'ore.

VOTO: 6

----------
GRAFICA
----------
Graficamente cartoonesco, con tratti puliti.

--------
AUDIO
--------
L'audio niente di straordinario.
Sottotitoli in italiano.

-------------
GAMEPLAY
-------------
Rompicapo ambientale con un pò di platforming, basato sul mandare avanti e indietro il tempo a due ere prefisse, oppure nel congelare l'istante. Non è difficile, anzi, però gli enigmi sono davvero ben studiati,
occorre concatenare le abilità dei due protagonisti e utilizzare anche l'ambiente circostante.

----------
STORIA
----------
Molto semplice, è facile con poche parole spoilerare tutto il gioco, per cui vi lascio la scoperta, tanto dura davvero poco.

---------
DURATA
---------
Il più grosso inconveniente è che dura poco (circa 2 ore).

-----------------------------
PROBLEMI TECNICI / BUG
-----------------------------
Ogni volta che si avvia il gioco è sempre in finestra, occorre andare in impostazioni e reimpostare a fullscreen (2 volte).
Personalmente mi ha dato noie nel riconoscere il controller XBox360, per risolvere ho creato un nuovo profilo dispositivo nelle opzioni di Steam e poi funzionava.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998856370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1676409019}

author: {'steamid': '76561198264305879', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1586046157}
review: I played through this game once, and have just picked it up here and there since then. I really enjoyed the game, the stories, the art, and the puzzles.  Definitely recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198286689881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1589052218}
review:
Em Chronology, assumimos o papel de um senhorzinho cientista, que para salvar sua cidade, das garras de seu mentor, faz uso da manipulação do tempo. No jogo podemos andar, pular, congelar, acelerar e retroceder o tempo. Além, de contar com a ajuda de um caracol em certos momentos. Devemos resolver puzzles, alguns bem tranquilos, outros mais complicados, para irmos avançando os capítulos. Que são poucos. O jogo tem um total de oito deles. A duração do jogo, depende da velocidade que você leva pra resolver os puzzles. O jogo possui tradução para o português brasileiro, o que é sempre bom. Não possui conquistas, mas possui cartas e uma ótima insignia, para quem curte. É altamente recomendável, para quem gosta de um bom jogo de plataforma, com uma boa história, e bons puzzles para se resolver. Vale a pena tanto no preço comum, quanto nas promoções que costuma ter. É jogar e se divertir !   

Gameplay que fiz: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L7BOGX5Nc5k&t=97s Confira.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015483969', 'num_games_owned': 5459, 'num_reviews': 426, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1586855637}
review:
Просто хорошая игра.
Приятная картинка в игре, такая милая (детям младшего возраста понравится). А вот сюжетные междууровневые вставки та ещё гадость, они вообще ни к селу ни к городу - диссонируют с картинкой в игре. Ну а короткость игры вполне уместна, не успевает надоесть.
Есть нарекания по русской локализации: она мальца с приблатом. Это блин детская игра, а в ней такие выражения герой "гонит", ну не для детей они. Также не хватает достижений, была бы идеальной пройденной игрой.
Кстати на удивление последняя локация - восьмая, самая лёгкая и самая короткая во всей игре (проходится минуты за четыре, это вместе с диалогами), такая вот неожиданность :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198122112683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1582461204}
review: A charming and entertaining game, interesting puzzles, bright colours, great characters and voice acting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191149025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1585230936}
review: It's a cute little game with nice graphics. There isn't much of a story there, the puzzles are mostly simple and you can finish the game in about 2 hours. There are annoying bits (the tooth plant puzzle, the jumping sequences with the saws) that may make you a bit frustrated but overall it's a relaxing game worth the money. I encountered one problem while playing - the game 'froze' when I was switching between characters - I could switch back and forth between them, but couldn't move any of them. Luckily just restarting the game resolved it. I wish it was a bit longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077153956', 'num_games_owned': 4293, 'num_reviews': 481, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1584639670}
review: Баловаться со временем после Braid моветон, но датчан из Bedtime Digital Games это явно не останавливало. Почти два года они пилили своё высказывание на тему таймлайнов и наконец выпустили Chronology. Игра, несмотря на все свои недостатки воспринимается скорее положительно, главный герой старик с феской путешествует в компании роботизированной улитки, решая совместно простенькие и логичные задачи. Прохождение занимает всего один час и никаких сложностей за исключением двух последних глав не доставит даже ребёнку. И это немного расстраивает только входишь во вкус и финальные титры. Спрашивается почему такую короткую игру делали долгих два года, а ответ просто - картинка, графика в игре нарисована вручную и стилизована под рисунок из гуаши, и вроде деталей не карте немного, да каждую пришлось как минимум дважды рисовать. Простенькая незатейливая аркада ручной работы на 1 час.. Оценим в 6.0

author: {'steamid': '76561198993530358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1692817777}
review:
Połączenie platformówko-zręcznościówki z grą logiczną lecz bardziej polecam dla fanów kombinowania. Fajna i dość krótka (przejście powinno zająć ok.2h lub dłużej jeśli na czymś utkniemy), ale to nie znaczy że nie potrafi sfrustrować w kilku momentach (tak przyznaję się, sam poległem na zagadce z kwiatkiem i bileterką i musiałem zasięgnąć wskazówek w społeczności, czego nie lubię i się wstydzę, ale bez tego bym gry nie ukończył; resztę gry przebrnąłem sprawnie i bez większych kłopotów). Ma kilka niedopracowań, np. jak upuścimy przedmiot w wyjątkowo nieodpowiednim momencie albo na polu z inną interakcją (np. rozmową), możemy już przedmiotu nie odzyskać i cały poziom trzeba będzie zaczynać od nowa.  
Polecam grać na padzie, gdyż dużo wygodniej niż na klawiaturze można na nim pokonywać elementy zręcznościowe. 

Plusy:
+ ciekawy pomysł i rozwiązania
+ ciekawa historyjka
+ przyjemna . . .

Minusy:
- . . . ale potrafi sfrustrować
- drobne niedopracowania
- cena (kupiłem na wyprzedaży za 2,69zł, więc śmieszna cena ale pozawyprzedażowych 18zł to bym za nią nie dał; nie jest warta więcej niż 5-6zł)
- lubi długo ładować poziomy, niezależnie od sprzętu
- zwiastun zawiera strasznie dużo spoilerów i rozwiązań zagadek

author: {'steamid': '76561198106000024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1581094852}
review:
Если уж делать игру-головоломку, то её механики должны быть продуманы так, чтобы герой не застревал в текстурах без возможности освободиться. Я, возможно, многого хочу, но когда это происходит в КАЖДОЙ главе раза по три и нужно переигрывать главу с самого начала... Нет уж, увольте. 

Задумка хороша, графика и музыка приятны, улиточка вообще прекрасна, но прыжки ооооочень деревянные, да к тому же море багов и застреваний. Итог: это малоиграбельно, не рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054547661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1580218484}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11196, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1579718426}
review:
Chronology is a family friendly 2D puzzle platformer game with a cartoony art style.   The game uses two reasonably well known platformer gimmicks, character swapping (each character has different abilities) and phasing (you switch between two different time periods which affects how the platforms and puzzle components are worked out). 

First up the artwork and storytelling here is charming and of good quality.   Unfortunately the game design and implementation doesn't keep up.  Controls are sluggish and unfun (yes, one of the characters is a snail, no it's not a deliberate pun).   You have to use the gimmicks constantly to progress inches at a time, this is painful and not at all fun for anyone.   On a technical basis, we have two big fails, fixed controls and fixed resolution (720p or 1080p), despite the fact the game was released when 4K monitors were readily available.  The developers haven't fixed that shortcoming despite keeping the game on Steam.   If the flaws with the game were fixed I could see it may warrant the $7.50 price tag, but they're not fixed so I can't recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114295998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1579531107}
review:
Tite évaluation pour prévenir les nouveaux d'un bug qui peut arriver sur le système win 10 :

Au bout d'une heure de jeu, et après maintes réinstallations, plusieurs utilisateurs n'arrivent plus à lancer le jeu, chaque options choisies dans le menu principale ayant le même effet que "QUITTER", le menu principale se ferme et basta tant pis pour vous.

Allez lire le forum, nous sommes nombreux dans ce cas depuis septembre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014473461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1576453091}
review:
[h1]Criminally under-rated puzzle-platformer[/h1]
[list][*]Yes, it's short -- 8 levels, each with only a few central puzzles.
[*]Yes, you can't skip cut-scenes -- but they're only 30-45s at the start of each level. 
[*]Yes, the puzzles are sometimes a little tough -- but each one is quite different and unique. The puzzles are the main draw here.
[*]Yes, the platformer controls can get frustrating -- but there's only one all-platformer sequence, near the end, and you don't restart the whole level if you die.
[*]Yes, the story is a bit thin and trite -- but it's fine.[/list]
Overall, [i]Chronology[/i] is just quirky and fun in all the right/rare ways. It's not a [i]Braid[/i] knockoff, it's doing its own interesting thing, and it's damn good at it.

[quote]For more puzzle game reviews, news & everything puzzle-related, follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/25928931-Puzzle-Lovers/]Puzzle Lovers[/url] & check out our [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/puzzlelovers]Steam group[/url].[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198017684563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1570272182}
review:
Excesivamente corto, bastante fácil, música repetitiva, control regulero, a veces los tiempos de carga son muy largos, la historia ni fu ni fa, algunas (muchas) cosas no tienen mucho sentido, ...

Por contra, gráficamente no está mal y tiene algún concepto interesante de manejo del tiempo (avanzar y retroceder para cambiar el entorno), pero en general una idea muy desaprovechada.

Lo siento, pero no me ha gustado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025089345', 'num_games_owned': 2174, 'num_reviews': 2933, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1570196891}
review:
年代纪~游侠有个汉化~但是不支持steam~打了汉化文字显示不了且卡卡卡~
没有成就~要是卡关可以去指南里看攻略视频~

[h1]键位简单[/h1]
Space跳跃、上下左右->移动、
W穿越过去和未来（大爷）让时间停止（蜗牛）、
A切换蜗牛和大爷、
S召唤蜗牛到大爷边上
~可键位多了总会手忙脚乱的~

于是我只好用英文版随意猜剧情咯~
一个老爷爷穿越了，啥都记不得了，我是谁，我在哪，我要干啥~？
没办法，大爷只能朝前走，这个世界很危险，到处是废墟和可怕的怪物。
没多远，大爷捡到了一件可以随时改变时间的小钟！于是，借着道具他逃离了森林！

然后利用改变时间的能力，大爷可以
在过去种下一颗树，在未来将这棵树作为垫脚石；
在过去拿一样东西到未来，那件东西在过去就消失了；
在过去的位置跳起，到现在的位置落下！（居然没摔死！）
在过去救下一些植物，到未来~~~

于是~大爷在过去救下了一个快渴死的某植物，并利用它的根茎过了河。
还利用它射出去的东东得到了一个铁蜗牛壳~还带了个穿梭时空的钟~
很快这蜗牛壳就有用处咯，前方正好有个蜗牛缺了壳！给它~

然后大爷和蜗牛一起穿梭时空咯~
蜗牛可以瞬间到达大爷的位置，
蜗牛可以停止时间，让某些机关失效or停在空中等等~

游戏关卡其实不算多~8关~3个小时就能通关~而且拖沓内容不多~
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1880166664
可惜我看不懂剧情~emm~汉化版本早就失效了~
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1880166373

所以~结局到底是啥~剧情说的到底是啥~?emm~
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1880166077
[h1]虽然我通关了~但是我并不清楚这游戏说的是啥~[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198099310591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1570077639}
review:
The present and the past has been... screwed up. You play as Old Inventor ( a kind of gnome thing) and as Snail, your side-kick and frenemy. While your power is over time, Snail controls the speed of time. Switching between the past and the present, and between slowed or normal time, you solve puzzles to progress through the 8 chapters. At the end you stop the mad guy, Mentor, from screwing everything up completely.

Chronology is relatively short. I left it paused for a few hours but could probably have completed the game in 2 hours or thereabouts. The puzzles are rather straightforward but there is still a sense of accomplishment once you pass each one - especially when you do it first time. The last chapter, with the banana, is a little confusing at first but jiggling time back and forth the path forward soon becomes apparent.

Chronology's charm is in its simplicity. Not a lot of puzzle platformers are just plain old simple fun these days. It doesn't take a puzzle genius to figure these puzzles out. The aim of Chronology seems to be not in having amazing powers of deduction but rather in just enjoying a story balanced against its gameplay.

I ran into [b]zero[/b] problems with lag or response between screen and keyboard. Zero issues with graphics. Zero bugs. My [i]only[/i] recommendation is that if you pick up an item - key, banana, bucket, flower, etc - don't drop it right on top of an interactable element like a power switch because, like with any game, if you put two interactable items on top of one another, one will override the other.

I very much so appreciated the auto-save - I could turn Chronology off at [i]any[/i] point and it would pick back up [i]exactly[/i] where I was - and, if/when you die, Old Inventor respawns very close to where you last were.

I definitely I got my moneys worth with Chronology - Under $10 for 2+ hours of entertainment is, imho, pretty darned good. And I'm always happy to pay full price for indie titles, keeps them mean big guys on their toes.

Chronology is developed by [url=https://store.steampowered.com/developer/bedtimedg] Bedtime Digital Games[/url], the same outfit that made [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/493540/Figment/?curator_clanid=33021788]Figment[/url] and [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/308040/Back_to_Bed/?curator_clanid=33021788]Back To Bed[/url]. Both of those are worth checking out. If you're interested in trying some of Bedtimes games out there's a free demo of Figment here on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129137447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1566178561}
review:
Chronology - Bom - 8/10

Trata-se de um jogo  bem curto de plataforma cheio de puzzles (enigmas) criativos. 

O tema principal é viagem no tempo e deixa a mensagem que suas ações do passado afetam o futuro.Quem nunca ficou pensando como poderia ter evitado um erro do passado?

O ponto que chama atenção no jogo é a mecânica dos personagens. Você pode alternar entre o velho e caramujo. O velho pode alternar entre o passado e futuro, já o caramujo pode parar o tempo. Dominar as mecânicas é fundamental para a progressão no jogo.


O jogo é simples, mas é divertido. Recomendo para todos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208370897', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1566128749}
review:
[h1]Generally[/h1]

Chronology is a platform-adventure game about time travelling, Bedtime Digital Games studio is responsible for the production of this game. In the game we take on the role of an Old Inventor and a Snail.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

This is a platform game in which our goal is to control an old inventor who, due to his amnesia, landed in a world he knows well, but destroyed. At the beginning of the game he discovers that we can manipulate time with a found watch. It is this watch that will allow us to go through the next levels, of which there are 8 in total. The game mechanics are very simple and pleasant. 

[h1]Sound[/h1]

Soundtrack in the game is pleasant, depending on the situation, the music changes. Ambient sounds are also ok. Dubbing in the game is ok, but there is not much of it.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]

The graphics are in fairy tale style and very pleasant. Although it is a low-budget game, it looks very good. 

[h1]Summary[/h1]

Chronology is certainly not a game that was on my list of games that I want to play. However, I can not say a bad word about this game. This is a really good game for a platformer, although the puzzles are too simple. In addition sometimes a character can juggle or behave strangely, but it is not an element that rejects this game.
[b]
✔️Cheap
✔️Short
✔️Pleasant graphics
✔️Nice soundtrack

❌Few bugs
❌Too simple puzzles

[i]Time of completion:  2-3 hours[/i]

[b][u]Rating: 6.5/10[/u][/b]

[i][h1][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34408584/]Follow my curator for more reviews[/url][/h1][/i][b]
ATTENTION!
Please note that this is only my evaluation and opinion of the game. If you do not agree with it or think that the game deserves a higher or lower rating, please leave a comment and I will be happy to respond.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198101035178', 'num_games_owned': 2348, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1564344196}
review:
I got the game for FREE, but I will be objective.

PROS:

- Interesting gameplay and unique, fun mechanics
- Very aesthetic art mixed with a bit of weird art
(both art styles mesh together well with the final product)
- Good music, ambient sounds, effects and soundtrack
- Good voice acting (not the best, but really good)
- Variation in that the game will go easy on you if you miss the goal by a bit
- Short and sweet
- Family friendly and okay for ALL audiences to enjoy
- Good jokes and mediocre puns that can make you chuckle

CONS:

- Bugs (there are bugs, probably related to the game engine or certain actions. Also seeing "R.I.P. jokingly being stated for one of the studios behind this games, means that the developers probably have no intention of fixing anything)
- The game is kinda orientated toward children and family playing together too much
- Really short - it took me exactly 6 hours and I don't rush games and try everything possible
(trying to find easter eggs, hidden areas and never looking for Internet hints)
- Price is a little bit much for the game's cons. 5 euros seem a bit high - get it on sale (even 40% OFF will do)

The pros outweigh the cons and I actually really enjoyed the game and geniuinely wanted to FINISH it, no matter how long it was.

author: {'steamid': '76561198410169156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 485, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1564202650}

The gameplay is just like one of titanfall 2 mission that in order to remove some obstacles and evade some closed doors you have to use a device to go back and forth on time, but this time there is also a snail helping you. grab it on sales.

author: {'steamid': '76561198809108110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1573560744}
review: 打折时入的，不要太值。虽然流程比较短，我大概花了三小时通关，但是各方面都很优秀。横板解密加动作都是我很喜欢的元素，谜题和动作都是刚刚好，不是很简单那种，也不是很难，就是那种你动动脑子会恍然大悟的那种。而且画风精致又可爱，英音旁白不要太享受，小老头（不是贬义，我找不到合适的词）和蜗牛的互动太可爱了，满满的英式幽默，可惜后面的场景和蜗牛互动少了。总体来说，非常值得一玩。是一次让人心情愉悦，很放松，很开心的体验。

author: {'steamid': '76561198301707455', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1563671707}
review: Относительно короткая, но не очень(примерно два с половиной часа, не успеет наскучить простотой, но и не закончится слишком быстро, как многие другие игры такого рода "на пробу") игра-платформер с относительно простыми загадками(только раза три было не совсем понятно, сначала, что нужно делать в том или ином месте). Относительно неплохая рисовка(правда вставки между уровнями в этом плане плачевны), относительно интересная простая история с "временными сдвигами". В целом все. Но само исполнение этих временных сдвигов, включая помошника-улитку, сделаны неплохо и интересно. В общем, за свою цену, а тем более если будет скидка, заслуживает своего внимания. Я бы поставил 8 из 10 в целом, или 9 из 10 за своего рода "вполне удачный проект на инди конкурсе".

author: {'steamid': '76561198140310200', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1563227670}
review:
Милая, интересная история. С этой игрой справиться  и одноклеточный она очень легенькая, чтобы пройти игру полностью не нужно тратить много времени.
Главный герой спасает мир от катастрофы с помощью машины времени, которая переключает состояния уровней "прошлое" и "будущее".  Совершенные действия повлияют на уровень. Второй игровой персонаж - Улитка. может ползать по стенам и потолкам и останавливать время.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095297504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1562884653}
review: Sympathique puzzle-platformer. Plutôt joli, court (moins de 2 heures), simple. Les mécaniques sont intéressantes : une machine à voyager dans le temps permettant de switcher entre passé et présent et un escargot compagnon capable de figer le temps (et doté d'une carapace bien pratique). Les puzzles auraient mérité d'être un peu plus fouillés, mais l'ensemble donne une expérience agréable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176675135', 'num_games_owned': 3349, 'num_reviews': 2842, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1561359281}
review:
[h1]向日葵游戏评分：7分（1-10）[/h1]
这是一款包含解谜和平台跳跃元素的冒险游戏，玩家需要来回切换老爷爷和蜗牛，利用他们各自的能力来解开谜题。老爷爷可以进行时间旅行，蜗牛可以吸附在墙壁上移动。
游戏的关卡设计非常巧妙，美中不足的是关卡流程较短，跳跃时空中的横向移动手感也不是很好。
[h1]欢迎大家关注我们的鉴赏家：https://store.steampowered.com/curator/28763059[/h1]
[h1]关注微信公众号和头条号“向日葵游戏”获取更多资讯；官方微博：向日葵游戏评测[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198033488663', 'num_games_owned': 717, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1561239092}
review:
Te loading są tragiczne. Mając dysk SSD i tak czeka się niesamowicie długo, już bardziej wymagające sprzętowo produkcje szybciej się ładowały.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219343843', 'num_games_owned': 16122, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1558363067}
review: A fun little puzzle platformer with nice art and voiceovers. It allows the player to shift between past and present versions of the same map, as well as a second controllable character later on, and utilizes this mechanic to clear obstacles, reach higher ledges, or find other means to advance. Some of the puzzles might stump you since the interactive pieces don't always stand out in any appreciable way, nor does the game hold your hand in teaching you what to expect. If you don't mind trial and error experimentation, then you'll probably enjoy Chronology. Can be completed in about 1-2 hours. Safe for young children, no mature content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042620952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1377, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1557423173}
review:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein 2D Puzzle Platformer mit Zeit Manipulation

[h1] Story [/h1] Ein Erfinder und sein Mentor haben ein Artefakt entdeckt/erfunden was in Falsche Hände Böse Auswirkungen haben könnte. Der Mentor nahm das Artefakt an sich und wurde Wahnsinnig und die Welt stürzte ins Chaos während der Erfinder einfach fort ging.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Wir spielen den Erfinder der in die Vergangenheit zurück reisen möchte um seinen Fehler zu korigieren. Bald trifft er auf eine Schnecke die ebenfalls Negative Erfahrungen mit dem Mentor erlebt hat und die beiden machen sich Gemeinsam auf den Weg den Mentor zu stoppen. Es gibt 8 Level/Kapitel in denen wir verschiedene Rätsel lösen müssen. Wir können bzw. müssen hierbei von der Gegenwart in die Vergangenheit switchen oder die Zeit komplett anhalten um Puzzle zu lösen. Oftmals müssen wir die Fähigkeiten der Charaktere verbinden (Schnecke hält die Zeit an und Erfinder wechselt in die Vergangenheit um über Hindernisse zu kommen oder Gegenstände aufzunehmen). Die Rätsel sind relativ einfach und schnell lösbar. Die Animationen & die Musik sind dabei Hervorragend.

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ Hübsche Grafik
+ Nettes Gameplay
+ Sehr Gute Musik (besonders die Hauptmenü Musik & der Song im Abspann sind Super)
+ Sehr Gute Animationen
+ Guter Sound
+ Story ganz OK
+ Nette Rätsel
+ XBox 360 Controller Support
+ Sammelkarten

- Leider keine Achievements

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Ein richtig Hübscher Netter Puzzle Platformer der sowohl für Erfahrene als auch für Anfänger sehr geeignet ist. Die Rätsel sind relativ einfach aber gut. Eine ganz Klare Kaufempfehlung

author: {'steamid': '76561198111278439', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1557341839}
review:
This game has an interesting mechanic, which makes it fun to use. Although it loses the surprise factor quite rapidly. I also started to get a bit annoyed in chapter 4 when I had to restart the level 2 times due to 2 different bugs. One the abilities stopped working and the other the screen started flickering after my character died and it didn't respawn.
The ending seems very rushed and the story wasn't very engaging.
I liked the concept and it was fun at the start but that was it.
I think this could be a great hit if it was given more depth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025586135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1556978451}
review:
Not a bad game so I will not give a negative rating
But I did find some things annoying about the game
- Controller and action response is a bit slow
- Changing response between times past and present & stopped and constant is a bit slow
- Not a game that can continue playing repeatedly 
- Sometimes you make a mistake and cannot revert it, like dropping a key next to cannonballs, and unable to pick it up again. So you have to restart the whole chapter... not that it is long but still
- I know it was short game but it is very short. Not even many cutscenes of his past

On that note, what was good
- The game is simple and you have to accept this 
- music was cute along with the graphic sprites which are ok
- the puzzles were not hard and not boring either, they allowed for a little challenge and good timing (better response from controller).
- like the option to bring objects from different times
- Animation is good

The story seems very similar to the Disney Up, on the note that you have to consider that the character is really dead and facing these adventures with his trusty snail that moves him along (for schmeckles) in the afterlife. 
Definitely a game for all ages. 
Although its a thumbs "UP" I would like to hope the developers would put more effort into future projects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198397464077', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1553205634}
review:
Chronology é um game de aventura em uma ambientação 2D de plataforma e puzzle, com gráficos muito caprichados. 

Na história, o protagonista Old Inventor, acorda desnorteado sem se lembrar o que aconteceu, em um lugar devastado. Com progredir do game ele encontra um relógio que permite alterar entre o passado e o presente, que vai auxiliar para resolução de vários puzzles. 

O jogo é bem simples, contando com oito capítulos que levam em média entre quatro a nove minutos para serem completos. Sendo assim o game é bem curtinho, mas ainda assim divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275058241', 'num_games_owned': 1983, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1553081793}
review:
Un petit jeu super sympathique, avec de beaux designs, qui vous fera passer quelques heures à cogiter dans la bonne humeur. Les puzzles des derniers tableaux vous feront même chauffer les neurones !

Deux personnages à incarner dont vous pouvez combiner et/ou coordonner les actions. Vous jouerez aussi avec le temps (passé/présent/futur, pas de timing!), le tout avec une évolution des compétences très intuitive.

Je conseille une manette de jeu pour le confort du gameplay mais se joue très bien au clavier aussi.

Amateurs de casse-tête n'hésitez pas et lancez-vous dans l"aventure, vous ne serez pas déçus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1550797439}
review:
Tags: Platformer
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Short duration. Puzzles. Two protagonists. Levelswap from past to future. Uninteresting story. Gets annoying to manage the gimmicks.

Chronology is your typical indie puzzle platformer. Each act is rather short, but having to constantly level swap. As well as transition from the snail to the old man gets a bit tedious. Some of the solutions need some thinking while others have you trickjump across simple platforms. The short duration and forgettable setting makes this a prime candidate for archiving in hidden library. I am not exactly fond of puzzle platformers and there is little enjoyment or replay value left after getting through it once.

I would recommend checking out Gianna Sisters instead for a more action oriented take on a similar concept.
https://store.steampowered.com/app/223220/Giana_Sisters_Twisted_Dreams/

author: {'steamid': '76561198166076478', 'num_games_owned': 797, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1546723249}
review:
I'm only 20 minutes into this game but I have so far played about 6 or 7 minutes of gameplay. On my current low-end laptop (which can run The Witness, Hollow Knight, almost all 2D Indie game with ease), there are achingly long load times. Unfortunately these are also placed in between the short cutscenes, meaning you end up waiting through a long load time to see a 30 or 40 second cutscene, and then go back into a long load time.

This game is full of charm, and I will probably come back to it when I upgrade my machine. The small glimpse of the time-bending mechanic I have managed to see is well implemented, in terms of aesthetic and sound design, and I imagine the developers have done interesting things with it. Unfortunately, some of the game's sound effects are horribly compressed which really takes away from the great voice acting. The music seems well written, but the sound is unbalanced so it gets washed out by the crunchy sound effects.

So far, this game does a lot in the right direction: The mechanics seem well thought out, the writing and voice acting is solid and the main character seems charismatic. For every good thing, however, there seems to be a drawback that really does take away from the game experience as a whole. We'll have to see how it pans out when I get an upgrade but for now, it's a no from me =/

author: {'steamid': '76561198329200608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1545418204}
review:
-切換時空的解謎遊戲。
-英文不至於太難，但看不懂也不會影響遊戲進行。
-手殘玩家在此保證，絕對不會卡關。
-小品故事，不拖泥帶水，建議打折時購買。
[strike] -工具蝸牛隨時為您服務。[/strike]

author: {'steamid': '76561198427374354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1545174418}
review:
A cute little platform puzzle game with a neat time manipulation mechanic, which allows you to switch between past and future, as well as freeze time. You play as two interchangeable characters, a wizard and a snail and the puzzles are mostly well done and fun, although a couple did stretch the game’s internal logic a bit, and were hard to figure out. It’s an entertaining and enjoyable game, though pretty short. It took me around 4 hours to complete.

I do have two gripes, though. Firstly, it lacks a save game feature, so if you have to quit the game for any reason (for example, as a result of the several progress breaking bugs I encountered) you have to restart the level, and secondly, it lacks a couch co-op option. With 2 characters at play, it really felt like this was  missing.

If you like the time manipulation bit, I recommend that you give the game ''Seasons After Fall'' a go. It’s got a similar mechanic and is an excellent game.

review:
Nice little puzzle/platformer game that utilizes freezing time/time travel to manipulate your surroundings and solve puzzles.  Short game, 2 hours to beat - and that was basically playing chapter VII twice since progress is only saved upon completing a chapter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085694933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1531344436}
review:
[h1]Se te queda la cara de tonto[/h1]

[i]Chronology[/i] es un juego de plataformas en 2D con puzles muy fáciles de poquísima calidad. Esto va de pasear y mirar el bosque ya que ni las breves plataformas que encontrarás son dignas de llamarse plataformas.
La historia no está bien desarrollada, solo hay una intro, un amago de algo y un final apresurado. ¿Dónde diantres está el nudo? ¿Cuál es el conflicto?, ¿cuál es el motivo por el que uno de los personajes se vuelve tonto y villano? ¿De dónde salió ese caracol? ¿Quién diantres eres tú? Todo un sin sentido.

Las pocas ambientaciones que se nos presentan son tan básicas con una camiseta blanca en oferta del “Pull&Bear”. Se nos brinda una mecánica de adelantar y retroceder en el tiempo con un simple clic y así aprovecharnos del entorno. Esto es la mayor baza del juego y la verdad no resulta demasiado interesante (no es una mecánica nueva). Hay que alternar el tiempo para saltar sobre mecanismos y estructuras nuevas, o por el otro lado,  beneficiarse del paso de los años y tener un escenario lleno de elementos deteriorados. Así constantemente para sortear los obstáculos. 

El juego va dirigido a un público infantil (con esa edad de ver Disney Channel y Boing) o especialmente a usuarios recién llegados al mundo de los videojuegos. La facilidad y la brevedad del título puede ser un insulto al jugador medio experimentado. 
Tras superar los 3 primeros niveles (son el tutorial), seguimos con 4 niveles más que son fáciles y cortos (contamos ya con 7 niveles que han hecho la función de toma de contacto para aprender la mecánica completamente). Cuanto todo parece que se pondrá interesante llegamos al nivel 8 donde sin jugar más te dicen que es el fin. No hay enfrentamiento con el jefe final y la historia se cierra de un plumazo sin que des cuenta de que esto ya se acabó.

La cara de bobo que se te queda es digna de un TV Show de cámara oculta. Pedí la devolución porque me parece caro por 3 niveles de un juego sin sentido. 

Buena idea para un juego que se queda muy muy lejos de merecer un aprobado. Mi opinión sería totalmete distinta si existieran 10 niveles más en los que aprovechar el concepto jugable. Para algo parecido con viajes en el tiempo instantáneos deberías probar [i]Silent Age[/i]. Es una aventura gráfica con buena historia y mecánica similar. Todo el juego se siente como un trabajo desmotivado y eso me pone triste.
  
[b]Lo mejor[/b]: la mecánica de adelantar y retroceder en el tiempo para superar el nivel no es nueva pero es entretenida. La ambientación de los niveles de bosque con lluvia es agradable.
[b]Lo peor[/b]: la historia es chirriante y muy mala, existen anuncios de TV más largos, en realidad solo existen 3 niveles con consistencia. Algunos puzles con fallos que te harán reiniciar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208078171', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 553, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1531159347}
review:
First level was really boring. I just pressed B (controller) alot to swap behind the past and the present/future? and move a block or two, trick a guy, let something rust away or let the landscape slightly change for me to jump over to it.

Second level was the same, however it's looking like you will have to do the platforming parts mixed with the changing time parts, no big deal really.

But then, there you get the snail. Holy balls the snail's voice is the worst thing in the fucking world. It's so "I'm on a kids show at 7am with all this energy" type of voice. Just google it if you need to hear it to understand but it's bad.

I'm done with the game now because the platforming wasn't hard, the puzzles were way to straightforward, the art is mediocre and simple and the idea just feels like it was implemented way to clunkily for my taste. I understand I haven't played much but I don't really have anything in this game that's drawing me back. It's all so bland, minus the snail voice. That's pushing me away.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995261977', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1531074816}
review: While this game is short, it's fun to play.  It immediately makes use of the present-time/future-time switching aspect without almost as soon as you begin.  The puzzles are nice brain-teasers without being annoyingly complex.  The artwork is nicely done with a good mix of color palettes distinguishing the brighter, full-of-potential present-time and the darker, post-cataclysm future.  I highly recommend playing with a controller.  In my opinion, it's a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010280803', 'num_games_owned': 4973, 'num_reviews': 327, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1529853347}
review:
年代记是一款横版动作解谜游戏。
      玩家扮演一名科学家老爷爷和另外一名邪恶科学家建造出一种蒸汽机器，这种蒸汽机器被邪恶科学家所使用破坏了文明世界。故事的开端玩家从一个濒临毁灭的世界中醒来，失去了他的记忆，需要找回自己的记忆并想办法过到过去改变世界即将毁灭的结局。随着故事的进展，玩家会遇上自己的伙伴一只小蜗牛，两人结伴去拯救世界。
      整个游戏的核心概念就是时间的改变，所有谜题都与时间有关联。科学家老爷爷的能力是使用自己的时间跳跃装置来进行穿越到过去和回到现在的事件点。蜗牛的能力是时间停止，不能跳，但能沿着墙壁移动以及使用自己的壳帮老爷爷提供站立点或者挡住有毒物质。
      加分点：1、画面比较漂亮，卡通化适合儿童。细节还不错，如花跟过去旧建筑到现在的变化。

                    2、音乐从低沉，急速，快乐的时刻都很贴合场景，充满活力。

                    3、难度比较低，主要难度更集中于谜题的思考上，操作上没多少要求。并且哪怕失败或者死亡老爷爷也能利用时间穿梭能力无限复活，毫无压力。整个游戏过程是比较悠闲的。
      减分点：1、虽然有古早前的汉化补丁，但是已经不能使用了。好在英文难度不是非常高。大概的内容还是能理解的。

                    2、剧情的设置以及角色的对话反转得很突兀，老爷爷和蜗牛的分开和结伴等等情节设置上的变化太无逻辑性，感觉是做给儿童玩的。

                    3、动画音乐等都很棒，但是8章的长度太短了。每章如果不思考太久卡关的话，那么6分钟左右一章并不稀奇，也就是说你能在一个小时内通关这个游戏。这个长度实在太短，只推荐慈善包入手。   

                    4、有几个小BUG，不过因主角能死后无限复活可以刷新通过所以不太影响。

      总体上属于能拿来悠闲的消遣一小段时间的游戏，游戏过程中感觉还是比较愉快的体验，缺陷在于太短。角色设定有点反转太快不过考虑到应该是供给儿童的游戏。做的很不错了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198049271328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1527886545}
review:
[b]DISCLAIMER - Got this as part of a massive bundle so effectively did not pay full price[/b] 
Nice little puzzle platformer which may be a little too much on the short side - only took me 2 hours to complete it.
It had fun little mechanics, and a good mix of puzzling and platforming.
The story is very simple. It wasn't terrible, just don't expect Shakespeare or anything. The characters are fine, though a little two dimensional (pun intended). I do think the inventor you play as cripples a guy for life in the name of progressing to the next level though soo...
Anyway all in all it's a nice way to spend two hours. Possibly longer or shorter depending on your puzzle-platforming ability. I would recommend it because of that, but wait for a sale to buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298377692', 'num_games_owned': 1198, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1890, 'last_played': 1471295871}
review:
Really Fun!
Easy Puzzle!

author: {'steamid': '76561198311670638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1559497529}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040882512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1526586197}
review:
This was a weird game with terrible voice acting (think like, early-2000s jRPG dubs bad) aggressively boring puzzle design and a nonsense plot. Also the characters were just awful. Why was the old guy such a terrible person?? My favorite scene was where he realizes he needs the snail and then in the same cutscene where he calls it back is already telling it to go fuck itself again. The most absurd part is that instead of a final boss battle you platform to the final boss' location and somehow your platforming causes him to drop dead and the game's like, well, he's dead, and then it just ends. It was incredibly bizarre.

The central mechanic is that you have a phenomenally specific time machine that takes you back and forth between two exact moments in time and you can use the differences in the landscape over time to platform. In practice is was stupidly simple -- go back, move a block, go forward, jump on block, go back move forward, etc. There was never any point at which it wasn't immediately clear what needed to be done and what needed to be done was always insultingly simple. It was all the worst things about indie platformers: more attention paid to painting the background than to creating a coherent game, and acting as though its trite elements were somehow super clever.

Also, it somehow had longer loading times than Witcher 3, which is an absurd thing to have to say about a 2-hour platformer.

that voice acting tho

author: {'steamid': '76561198035452392', 'num_games_owned': 907, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1526916768}
review: Cool short game. Simple platforming and neat little puzzles. Challenging enough and not frustrating. Good option if you feel like playing something short and sweet. Art is really nice too but may get in the way since sometimes you think it's a platform or something. Good thing you spawn nearby. Pretty cool game overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198370714154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1527446154}
review: Chronology is an interesting mix of ludic, puzzles whit time travel. I think it’s important to emphasize the flaw of this game, maybe the only one that bothered me. Chronology show us the lore in a very captivating way, all it’s relation with the time (not only in the story but also in the puzzles) gives the game a mysterious characteristic of a good storytelling. But this is not the flaw. With a story that hooks us in its beginning and puzzles following the same quality all we needed was charismatic characters. Well, Chronology also has it, not only the main character, but his partner (that sometimes took all the attention) Snail, the most cute thing in the game. Well, the artistic stuff then? No, this is not the flaw; the artistic work is very well done. The only flaw of Chronology is to have only 8 stages, making the game too short. With all those qualities it’s natural that we would like to play more and more of Chronology.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165223256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1526096181}

author: {'steamid': '76561198174768571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1525132207}
review:
Chronology is a fun, short, puzzle platformer that incorporates time trival, which affects the environment arount you. The story is more of just an outline really, as you spend time switching between the two main characters. Each one has their own ability and you need to combine their skills, to complete each level.

I did have a couple of issues with the game. Firstly, as others have mentioned, it sometimes hangs loading the chapters, but simply pressing shift-tab to briefly bring up the steam overlay, fixed it. Secondly, I had some screen tearing. I enabled v-sync on my GPU, which only helped a little. It only bothered me because I was enjoying the look of the game so much.

Overall, I think the best part of the game is the art style and music. Difficulty is pretty low, but I did have a little trouble with one puzzle near the end. The voice acting is passable, if a little ropy at times. Recommended though, for a coulpe of hours of puzzling fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045984337', 'num_games_owned': 1085, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1529170970}
review:
I've play this game years ago when it was released on Windows Phone 8, it was free for first 3 chapters, but as we all know the Windows Phone is a buggy OS it often crashed at some part an can't even reach the 3rd chapter. Just recently I discover this game is on Steam, so I buy it right away.

This game feature time travel puzzle, so you need to turn the time back or to future or stop the time to complete certain tasks. The puzzle difficulty is quite good, and the length of the game is short, about 2 hours to complete the game. 
The graphic is good, the voice acting is good, but the background sound is a bit dull. The ending is somewhat anti-climatic too, I was expecting some puzzle platformer based battle with final boss, the Mentor, but at least it's not a cliffhanger.

For "how much I like this game score" I will give 3/5 (not bad)

author: {'steamid': '76561198218969712', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1519844829}
review:
Gráficos : Que se puede decir. Tiene un estilo artístico bastante llamativo que me ha encantado contemplar.

Historia : Sin ser la historia más original del mundo, me ha parecido la adecuada para un juego que se centra más en la jugabilidad que en quedar en el recuerdo.

Jugabilidad : Me ha encantado la mecánica de los puzzles con la interacción del tiempo. He de reconocer que dos o tres veces me quedé un poco pillado sin saber exactamente como proceder pero se me hizo muy entretenido.

Música : Como con la historia, no creo que me quedé en el recuerdo.

Veredicto : Lo recomiendo para pasar un rato divertido (un rato bastante corto comprendido entre 1 o 2 horas).

author: {'steamid': '76561197972807050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1518896397}
review:
Entertaining and well designed 2D platformer even if relatively simple and a little annoying, but with ingenious technical twists revolving about the present and future states of the play zones.
The annoyment comes from some of the puzzles that are not really intuitive but they make sense once you figure them out.
The game will test your reflexes and your wits and the interaction variety is appreciable.

Relatively short but overall enjoyable and well made. Especially appreciable the fact that falling in pits or otherwise 'losing' doesn't punish you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113388537', 'num_games_owned': 4356, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1519385112}
review:
[quote]
[h1]An old mans tale[/h1]

He we got a nice and neat puzzle platformer with a rather short story.
This game is quite old and has been released a while back. But even then this game is playable and completable without a problem. 

I do like this game, i like the story, i like the characters and i like the world.
This game keeps a lot of things simple. You move with the arrow keys and controll and switch characters with wasd. Riddles aren´t that hard and the feature of travel betweem feature and past is well made. Everything is rounded with a well drawn graphics. The most beatiful things is the soundtrack. So good i bought it on the devpage, sadly its not avaible here on steam. 
Despites the goods things there are few things notable.
Mayor problem is the budget. Why?
Well this game is short and can be played within half and a hour. Story is nice but not deep. Same applies for the characters. 
Don´t get me wrong the combo between snail and old men is awesome and works well but afterwards you know nothing they are replacable. Not considering the main evil has no name except for the mentor, because he is/was his mentor.
Second thing were you see is how this game is made, how polished it is. Everything works with minor glitches but the flow needed  for a realy enjoyment is missing. The snail for example only looks in one direction no matter were it moves. 
Surely this is an indie title but this bugges me the most. An interuptes flow. I didn´t feeled absorbed into the game.

I realy hope i can see a game with simerlar mechanic and more content from the same devs. I wouldn´t mind building my own levels. 

If you are interested or got this game out of a bundle its good and a try worth. 
[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198074846013', 'num_games_owned': 1335, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1519373557}

author: {'steamid': '76561198243389216', 'num_games_owned': 1334, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1518354185}
review:
两小时通关，，，共7个章节，流程都不是很长，算是小品级的作品了吧。。。

作为一款横版解密类游戏，可控制两个角色（其中要进行切换）：
老头子的能力是时间回溯（共两个时间点即过去和未来），蜗牛的能力是时间停止[spoiler] the world！	[/spoiler]；
伴随这两个能力来进行解密通关，创意还是不错的，解密也都不难，在过去和未来多观察一下一般都能解出来（有时主角还直接说接下来要干嘛），适合打算消磨时间的时候玩一会儿；
不过流程也实在是太短了，感觉很可惜这个游戏系统啊！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198096114971', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1516330683}
review:
This game was good. I think the platforming was a bit hard. The level designs reminded me of those super mario maker levels people make where you have to jump perfectly right or you die. Really the art style and the platforming reminded me of the old school flash games.

The time travel idea was pretty good and the narration is pleasant. I only played chapter 1 before giving up on chapter 2 at the start of the level. I could not make it to the other platform. I got annoyed at the characters repeated HOOOOOOOOOOOoooooooo as he fell into the chasm. I know I could stick the jump eventually but I just did not feel like trying further when I have such a large back catalog of games to play and review. I am putting this in my "try later" pile. I feel like the price is good and kudos to the devs for including this in a charity bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354894013', 'num_games_owned': 850, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1516067437}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015846145', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1516039618}
review:
Great game with awesome graphics. It has decent story considering the length of the game. I bought it on sale for 1.24€ and it was very worth it for that money. 

You combine the present and the past in this game from which you solve some good logical puzzles alongside with platforming part. You can also freeze the time with the snail in the past/present and that is very cool! :) 

Also, the sound in the game is kinda mystical which fits thematics perfectly and the narration(yes this game has narration xD!) is pretty good in my opinion.

I'd give this game rating of 9/10 because it's kinda short but everything else is great!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970859560', 'num_games_owned': 5618, 'num_reviews': 358, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1514947728}
review:
There was potential here that went unrealized. The graphics are decent, reminiscent of Aquaria, and the sound and music are fine. The voice-acting is okay.

The controls are sloppy, the puzzles simple and repetitive even for a short game, and the primary mechanics (the time freeze and time reversal) seem almost...unnecessary. Near the end, right when you should be challenged to demonstrate competency at the mechanics learned through the game, they are abandoned entirely and it becomes a cheap Super Mario 3 clone. I got stuck in walls and had to reload several times. The storyline is muddled, and the protagnist only has enough personality to be dislikable. Seriously, why is he mean to that snail for no reason?

Art, assets, idea, all good. They needed better writing and way better level design. In my opinion, the makers should've fielded this for free on Kongregate then used what they learned to tighten up the ideas and make a better game, if they're going to charge money for it.

*Edit: Also, the load times are pretty unacceptable for what this is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076824543', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1515643516}
review:
I received this game from a friend.  So I gave it a try.  I had a feeling I would like it.  I was not wrong.  The game is delightful...while it lasts.  Although it is a puzzle-platformer, it has the feel of one of the old Lucasarts epics.  Yet its narrative ends so quickly that it perhaps can hardly be called an epic, even though it aspires to be.  Thankfully, there is no "fluff", but I couldn't help being disappointed, even though I received this as a gift.

I do recommend this game, but be forewarned that there is not much to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964345647', 'num_games_owned': 921, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1514671314}
review:
Art/Graphics: 4/5 (Beautiful world)
Immersion: 2/5  (Time spend idle takes you out of the game)
Gameplay: 2.5/5 (Basic)
Controls: 2/5 (Very clunky) 
Value: 3/5 (Inexpensive, but really felt like $1 value)  
Difficulty: 2/5 
--------------
Overall 2.7 (Difficulty always excluded)


Chronology is a puzzler platformer, which uses, rather than phase shift, a time shift mechanic (same difference really) to alter the world around you in order to traverse the world and progress.

I have to start by saying LOAD times are atrotious!!!  Half my paytime was loading each level.  There were numerous times I had to simply close the game and reopen to get the level loaded.

What about the good?  Well, it is beautifully designed, with pleasant voice over (though I feel like the writing targets children), but the character movements leaves a lot to be desired.  I suspect that the implementation flaws comes from the fact that it is a table port.

The game is very short, where you apply a number of mechanics to progress.  At some point a time stopping snail is introduced

Most of the puzzles are simple, but a few can be obscure [spoiler](in fact cruel)[/spoiler], but nothing that feels very satisfying.

I am definitely on the fence on this one, for $1 maybe yes, but because of the technical difficulties, I found it more tedious that enjoyable :(


ACHIEVEMENTS:  Sadly, none.


[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31208751/]Please follow my Pixel Art Curation to discover other great games...[/url]

NOTICE:  These are my opinions about the experience I had playing this game.  I share them in hopes that people who are like minded will either enjoy a suggested game, or avoid frustration wasting time and money on something I felt was a personal waste.  Please feel free to comment positively, but know that anything that trolls or is just simply negative comments will be quickly deleted.  The reality is, that my reviews are for people who do not own the game, not to initiate philosophical dialogue about it.  If you are passionate about this game, please feel free to share that in your own review.  

Funny nobody every trolls or bashes a positive review on steam ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198223274944', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1510032662}
review:
Un juego algo corto, aunque entiendo que su duración se deba a que probablemente esté pensado para un público de menor edad, pero muy bueno.
La mecánica de mover atrás y adelante el tiempo le da un toque muy interesante y te hace pensar un ratito qué es lo que hay que hacer .
Visualmente es muy agradable y las voces me parecieron muy bien realizadas.
Lo único que me pareció raro es lo poco que dura el capítulo 8 en comparación con los demás... incluso si es más difícil que los otros, que dure 1/5 de lo normal no me convence.
La historia si bien es bastante simple es interesante y está suficientemente bien desarrollada.
Por último, la música no es nada del otro mundo pero está muy bien.
Recomiendo este juego? Sí. De repente un adulto no tenga muchas ganas de gastarse 5 dólares en un juego más bien para niños, pero si se quiere jugar algo relajado viene muy bien, y ni que hablar que para un niño es un juego muy bueno.

review:
Просто хорошая игра без свяких завышеных ожиданий - 7/10

-Хорошый платформеный геймплей
-Приятная рисовка и музыка

-Правильная продолжительность и сложность (чтобы не надоесть).

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Just a good game without swaying the high expectations - 7/10

-Good platform gameplay
-Priorious drawing and music
-Normal plot (to justify running from left to right).
-The correct duration and complexity (not to get bored).

author: {'steamid': '76561197991465987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1508744711}
review: Chronology is your typical indie puzzle platformer, if there's such a thing - surprisingly evolved in some aspects, and rather raw around the edges in others. On the one hand, visuals are charming, the music is very good and the puzzles are mostly neat - on the other, the story and the characters are paper thin, the controls are unresponsive and the platforming in general is pretty bad. Luckily, the focus is on the puzzles, so altogether Chronology leaves quite a good impression. Nothing sort of the brilliance of Braid, but a solid entertainment, if a bit short (1.5-2 hours).

review: 一个简短的冒险解谜类游戏。一个会时空穿梭的老头和一个会时间停止的蜗牛互相配合度过难关，还算比较有趣吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198063825413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 804, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1612735002}
review:
Ein Spiel mit zwei Zeitebenen? Das klingt interessant. Ich wollte es nochmal spielen.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1148844278
[b]Metropolis darf nicht untergehen - Geschichte[/b]

Metropolis, die wohl nicht zufällig namensgleich zur Stadt Fritz Langs ist, ist vom Verfall bedroht. Wir spielen einen namenlosen alten Herrn, der dies zusammen mit einer süßen Schnecke verhindern will, indem er den Verursacher des Problems sucht.

Wirklich verstanden habe ich die Geschichte nicht, vielleicht habe ich ein paar Informationen verpasst. Mir schien es aber auch eher nur Aufhänger zum Gameplay zu sein.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1148865099
[b]Zeit ist relativ - Gameplay[/b]

Um in den 8 Kapiteln des Spiels voran zu kommen, muss der Namenlose nicht nur genreüblich über Plattformen hüpfen und Gefahren ausweichen. Vielmehr muss er auch die Zeit manipulieren. Es gibt ein Jetzt (allerdings im Spiel als "Before" bezeichnet") und ein Später ("After"), in dem die Welt leicht anders, verfallen, aussieht. Dies nutzt unser Mann ebenso, um Hindernisse zu überwinden, wie die Fähigkeit der Schnecke, die Umgebung zeitlich einzufrieren.

Da der Alte die Schnecke (fast) jederzeit zu sich rufen kann, ist es für den Spieler nur wichtig, den Knorz ins Ziel zu bringen. Dennoch sind beide Partner und aufeinander angewiesen.

Hinzu kommen ein paar Gegenstände, die richtig eingesetzt werden müssen und fertig ist das Gameplay. Heraus kommt ein relativ kurzes Spiel, in dem man die verschiedenen Möglichkeiten eifrig nutzen muss, um dann aber meist zügig voranzukommen.

Das ist auch gut so, da nur zu Beginn eines Kapitels gespeichert wird. Stirbt der alte Mann aber einen Bildschirmtod, so erscheint er in unmittelbarer Nähe zum Weiterspielen.

Die Jump&Run-Einlagen sind so einfach, dass ich mich frage, weswegen sie überhaupt drin sind.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1148845923
[b]Zeit für Micky Maus? - Technik[/b]

Die Grafik ist schön gemacht, nur nicht ganz mein Geschmack. Gemalte Hintergrundbilder, von denen es immer je zwei (für beide Zeiten) gibt, schnuckelige Maschinen, eine dauergrinsende Schnecke mit Warnlampe fürs Rückwärtsfahren, ein rauschebärtiges Fez-tragendes Männchen. Eine Inspiration durch den japanischen Regisseur Hayao Miyazaki konnte ich nun nicht wiederfinden, die da sein soll, aber es hat schon einen sehr schönen Stil, der nur manchmal ins kitschige abgleitet.

Der Sound ist gut, die Sprecher (Englisch) allerdings auch nichts besonderes, die Schnecke war mir leider zu piepsig. Dennoch immer noch OK. Es gibt auch deutsche Untertitel zu den englischen Sprechern der, wie es scheint, skandinavischen Produktion.

Die Handhabung mit Controller ist einfach. Tastatur (und Maus?) wurde von mir nicht getestet.

[b]Zeitliches[/b]

Ich habe für das erste Durchspielen 4h, beim zweiten Mal 2,5h gebraucht.

[code][b]In Zahlen für mich persönlich ein Unterhaltungswert von 7/10.[/b][/code]

Ein relativ kurzes und eher einfaches Rätselspiel in Jump&Run-Umgebung mit einer guten Idee bzgl. der Zeitmanipulation. Grafik und Sound wirkte auf mich aber etwas kitschig.

[hr][/hr]
[i]Dies ist mein subjektiver Spieleindruck. Für meine Wertung zählt, wie gut es mich unterhalten hat. Entsprechend der Daumen nach oben oder unten, abhängig davon, ob ich es einem ähnlich gesinnten Spieler weiterempfehle. Der Spieleindruck eines anderen Spielers kann aber durchaus stark davon abweichen.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198067133364', 'num_games_owned': 1272, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1506296076}
review:
I suppose I have acquired this game as part of a bundle. The concept looked initriguing and I thought I'd give it a shot. I beat the game in 3 hours (and I could have managed it in far less). The art style is pretty neat (reminds me vaguely of Bastion for some reason) and the puzzles are for the most part - fun. The characters add an interesting dynamic to the game, however it would feel like the snail is merely there to assist the inventor rather than having any purpose of his own.

The story is limited and does very little to explain why things turned out the way they did, or how the snail got involved, or what their motive really was... At times the controls feel a bit clunky and unconfigurable. However, my biggest issue with the game is its loading time. It's incredibly terrible. I don't see why such a short game could manage such long and dragging loading screens, and why on earth would there be a loading screen to load a cutscene?

All in all, I enjoyed the game despite its flaws. I'm not entirely sure that would justify its price tag though. If you find it on sale it might be fun for the short while it lasts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286066511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1505256155}
review:
Juego corto de unas 2 o 3 horas . Perfecto para los mas peques de la casa, plataformas y puzles unidos mediante el uso del poder de parar o retroceder en el tiempo. 
Aunque sea corto merece la pena jugarlo.
Consta de 8 capítulos donde manejas a un viejecito que se propone llevar a cabo la misión de salvar su ciudad por cosas que te irá contando el juego. 
es entrañable y al final se le coge algo de cariño a los personajes que usamos . Lo dicho, ideal sobre todo para los peques de la casa y para pasar un rato fuera de tantos disparos , LOL y todos estos juegos tan de moda.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982490998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 487, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1530478238}
review:
Je suis conquis et vous le recommande chaudemant si vous mettez la main dessus a petit prix car la durée de vie est trop courte pour le prix plein pot.
Visuellement, le jeu est beau. Le concept est génial: manipuler le temps pour que l'environnement se transforme et qu'on puisse avancer dans le niveau. En gros, toute modification dans le présent aura un impact sur le futur. C'est très simple mais très bien fait. Audio anglais et STFR, la bande son est très zen. Bref, une très bonne surprise pour moi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042327986', 'num_games_owned': 1456, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1501280734}
review: A simple puzzle platformer that takes two hours or less to complete. While the majority of puzzles are intuitive, some are a bit off the wall, with almost no sensible answer. The story and art are a bit bland, but they run together well enough. The mechanic of going back and forth in time does allow for an interesting experience, seeing the interpretation of years without human intervention to nature. My biggest confusion is the giant snail. Did nothing else suffice for the puzzles that require something to be able to cling to a wall? Why can it talk and teleport? The snail just seems more out of place than most anything else in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018812372', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1502498261}
review:
+ Beautifully animated characters and great art. This is its strongest asset by far. The logo is BEAUTIFUL and is really Kingdom Hearts-reminiscent!

- The sounds sometimes clip out when changing between characters (at one point the music entirely stopped until I progressed, or the music was there but some sound effects were missing). There also just weren't [i]enough[/i] sounds. Like, when you first launch the game, you must first press the space bar to bring up the options on the title screen, and there isn't even a click sound for it. It's just awkward to have the music rolling, for you to smack the key, and then see the menu come down with no indicator.

- The keyboard controls are unchangeable. This is a major issue, because there is only a faint arrow that briefly shows for your control changing between the snail and the character, so switching can be so subtle that you're not sure that it even happened. And then each character's individual power is accessed by the same key, which just caused a great deal of confusion that could easily be solved by assigning each power a separate, dedicated key.

- The game opens with music whose tune's first notes are nearly identical to Hans Zimmer's Pirates of the Caribbean theme. I know it sucks that note patterns can become taken forever by a composer like that, but that's just how art is, so the composer really should have noticed that and written a more original melody. As it is, it just sounds cheesy.

- The Inventor calls the Snail with different lines like "Come on, boy," and "I'd better find another way to call her." Huh?

- The plot was entirely nonsensical. It didn't explain how the snail could talk, why it's so big, how it could [spoiler]teleport to the Inventor's location across the map at a whim (and it can't jump so you can't chalk that up to time travel/time-stopping)[/spoiler].

- The puzzles, while some were interesting requiring both simultaneous powers of the characters, were disconnected tasks, which is completely opposite to the "Limbo + Braid" comparison that one reviewer made. Each screen of each area was basically its own self-contained puzzle. Nearly an hour in to chapter VI (where I stopped), maybe one or two at most spanned more than a screen's worth (which was usually because of [spoiler]a doorway in a city area that you had to enter to reach a remote room for a brief moment[/spoiler]). Combined with the unrelatable plot, they were tiring to me, personally.

This is a good game for kids under age 11 or so, but not beyond that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341033076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1502269863}
