author: {'steamid': '76561198314214489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1508579619}
review: The concept of shifting between the past and present anytime you want is excellent, but the game is very short. I completed it in just 3 or 4 hours. Grab it only when on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198320659800', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1692388568}
review:
Me gustó mucho, se ve muy bien, aunque le faltó profundidad en la historia y aprovechar un poco más la mecánica principal del juego.

Lo juego seguido con mi sobrino de 4 años. Él dice "juguemos el jueguito del abuelito con bigotes" jajaj Nos entretenemos mucho jugándolo.

A fin de cuentas es un juego divertido, decente, visualmente agradable, pero que le faltó ese "no sé qué, no sé dónde" para terminar siendo un juegazo.

Lo recomiendo para pasar el rato y entretenerse.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998216901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1484284329}
review: I tried this game twice and couldn't get into it. As a platformer, I didn't feel it succeeded...the characters just moved too slow for me. It felt a lot like a Flash game from the days of Macromedia. Interesting ideas, but ultimately not worth it to me. As someone else said, I personally don't like voting down games by smaller studios simply because the games they produce are often works of passion. This one just didn't work for me. Based on the majority of other reviews, though, it's very likely it will work for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038186186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1499254449}
review: Charming little game. A puzzle/platformer with time travel dynamic and cute characters. Doesn't take long to beat, so 5€ is probably a little much, but definitely worth picking up if it's on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047412737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1498400052}
review:
8/10
Son plus grand défaut : 3h pour le finir : trop court, j'aurais aimé que ça dure plus looongtemps...  
Très bon jeu, un peu en dessous de Braid, mais très bien quand même. 
Il y a quelques causes -> conséquences / passé -> futur. Ce point aurait mérité d'être un peu plus développé. 
Il n'y a pas de difficulté exceptionnel, hormis un seul endroit où j'ai bloqué un petit moment, et où la solution n'est pas évidente. 
Graphismes plaisants. J'aime beaucoup les animations de changement d'époque.
La maniabilité est bien gérée. 
Musique agréables.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064634224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1498029777}
review: Okay game, but not worth the long and/or buggy loading screens.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997381526', 'num_games_owned': 922, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1497039829}
review: I'm always sorry to downvote games made by small studios of indie developers but I cannot really recommend this game. The overall production value is very low, the art seems great when you begin the game but later on it feels uninspired and cheap. The story is nonsense like the characters, there's no way you can feel any kind of empathy for them. The game itself doesn't really know what it is, is it puzzle or platform oriented? Some puzzles are quite clever but nothing you will write home about. The platforming parts are sparse and completely gratuituous. The only redeeming factor is that you can finish the game in about an hour, because more of it would have been unbearable. I wish the developer more luck (and budget) for their future games but don't waste your time and money on this one.

review: Отличная задумка, шикарное музыкальное сопровождение и моментами заставляет хорошенько подумать :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198049238784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1495552106}
review:
+ Charming. Nice tunes.
- Short. Lineair. Hardly challenging.

The changing between eras is really smooth, and the world is very charming, kind of Oddworld-like.
The excuse plot is paper, and the puzzles barely touch the possibilities offered by time travel. Some are "plant sapling, tree grows", sure, but most of them could simply have the two eras as "changing planes". The presentation is fine, but the main course is left wanting.
Got it on ridiculous sale, recommended for that price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040527801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1495496757}
review:
Un univers succulent, avec deux personnages très vivants grâce à des dialogues bien agencés, une mécanique temporelle agréable, qui a nécessité de faire 2 fois le design de tous les niveaux, on y pense pas trop pendant le jeu !

Cela va vous prendre 2h dont 30min à chercher comment résoudre 3 énigmes.

Rien que pour la combinaison homme escargot, il vaut le coup.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070136255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1495322979}
review:
A unique "cute" game with a time control mechanic to solve interesting puzzles. The game mechanics are simple enough for casual players although the controls are surprisingly confusing and the game is quite short.

The game is great for what it was, only one or two obtuse puzzles unlike other puzzle games, and nice little story. I had my wife play it as she likes puzzle games and she described it having cute story and art . However, we beat it in under 2 hours and she is definitely not a speed runner so I'd definitely say the game felt a bit short. I would say this is may be for the better as the mechanics are simple enough the game would have eventually felt repetitive.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994471394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1495316575}
review:
Chronology

Pros:

* Beautiful soundtracks and scenery.
* Astounding time-traveling and time-freezing features to help you in your quest to solve puzzles.
* Relatively low price.
* A good 3-ish hours of gameplay.
* The snail is way too cute.
* Has trading cards.

Neutrals:

* Decent voice acting.
* Decent storyline.
Cons:

* No after game bonuses or content.
* No achievements available.
* Few characters.

Overall, Chronology is a relatively good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992180148', 'num_games_owned': 2514, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1493581935}
review: It took me 1.5-2 hours to finish, but I could have probably done it in one, so, sadly, it's really short. author: {'steamid': '76561198034928324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1492988166}
review:
Giochino senza infamia e senza lode, un platform ad enigmi come se ne vedono tanti ultimamente.
Gli enigmi sono a tratti estremamente semplici, basta ragionare un attimino sugli elementi a schermo e si trova la soluzione in pochi secondi.
Insomma, consigliato come tappabuchi se lo si trova sotto i 2 euro, data anche la sua scarsa longevità dato che lo si completa anche in meno di 2 ore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353816972', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1514595723}
review:
A fun and relatively short puzzle game.

Pros:

Pretty, fun, appropriate background music -- the only exception is the song during the end credits which is, quite frankly, awful. It doesn't fit the game at all.

It's fun to control both the old man and the snail.

Switching back and forth between the present and the future adds an extra element of thoughtfulness in regards to completing the puzzles.

The puzzles are somewhat complex, but not frustratingly so.

Cons:

The loading screen that occurs between each level takes 2-3 minutes to load. While this doesn't seem that bad, actually sitting through those 2-3 minutes multiple times becomes very tedious. It's not even that graphics-heavy of a game; I can't guess why these sort levels take so long to load.

The ending is very anticlimactic. In fact, the last level is the shortest one of all. SPOILERS AHEAD SPOILERS AHEAD And you don't even beat the mentor/boss yourself. The snail comes in and saves the day (by itself, not from you controlling it).

author: {'steamid': '76561198068385420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1492808412}

author: {'steamid': '76561198271621062', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1492342241}
review:
I got this game as a part of a Humble Bundle. The game looked enough like the sort of retro platformer I would like, and in that aspect, it did not at all disappoint. 

It is a short game and even if you are really slow in figuring out all puzzles (only two or three of which are really challenging) it would not last beyond 10 hours. 

I completed the game in a shade under 4hrs.

The only gripe I have with this game is that that there is no save in between the levels. If you exit the game somewhere in between, you will have to replay it from the last checkpoint. While it is not always a problem, some puzzles which require timing to see you through can pose problems if you have to redo them. 

Barring that one minor and entirely forgiveable flaw, I thoroughly enjoyed the game and how the time bending / stalling mechanics have been used to create puzzles.

The art is colourful, lively, and relaxing.

Is the game worth the asking price? Definitely!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041457591', 'num_games_owned': 1625, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1492437017}
review:
A reluctant thumbs up, mostly because of the low price tag.

I won't lie: the levels were pretty darn good: a 2-layered level design ('past' and 'future') where puzzle solving is central. When the snail comes in, you also get the ability to stop time. And those mechanics work well together (sort of like Lost vikings, but by far not as advanced). On top of that, it has beautiful graphics and sounds, so what more could you ask for...right?

Unfortunately, the game runs out of steam as it goes on. By the time you descend into metropolis, the puzzles lower in quality to an average point 'n click game, and almost suddenly it becomes nothing but basic platforming until the end. As said by others: it's short. That wouldn't be that bad (short games can be good too), but the storyline and boss battle seem to just be there because the developer ran out of money and/or ideas. Certainly compared to the intro, it's an anticlimax. :-(

Again: for five bucks, you can't expect miracles. And I certainly had fun with it. Just...know that the quality of the introduction won't last long...

author: {'steamid': '76561197960830998', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1485651017}
review:
Got this as part of HumbleBundle Christmas 2016, very low price. I'd recommend on sale, but not at full price. (unless its for kids!)

Needs a 50/50 rating on steam again for this one.

Puzzle platformer with novel ideas that don't really develop far enough. Great game for younger kids (13 and under) but a bit too easy for adults who've played the like before.

Pros:
1. Well presented, lovely colorful graphics and a good soundtrack
2. Nice use of features of time control etc
3. Feels good to play, really smooth controls

Cons
1. Too easy , only  a couple of puzzles gave a challenge
2. UNSKIPPABLE cutscenes. They aren't too long but I hate them
3. Not really developed as far as it could be, feels like a concept game - probably possible to finish in less than 2 hours.

5 out of 10 - If on sale its worth a pound or two, but you're looking at 2 hours and it's not always good to finish a game and wish it had more. This doesnt feel like it has quite enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025521262', 'num_games_owned': 600, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1483694389}
review: Pretty short, casual puzzle-platformer. With time control, of course, but that's nothing new. [i]Chronology[/i] oozes charm, from its quite pretty, hand drawn levels to its spritely music and just twee enough to be fun and not annoying voice acting. The writing is nothing to brag about, I even feel it misses a chance to pull a good timey wimey twist right near the end. Spoiler: [spoiler] Wouldn't it have been a gas if that kid whose leg you break turns out to be the Mentor/Villain from the future?[/spoiler] Where the game really shines is the individual mechanics of the two characters you play, (The Inventor and The Snail) who both control time in different ways. Going through the puzzles seeing the interesting ways their mechanics interact and fit perfectly into one another is what sells the game for me. Of course, being as short as it is, it feels like the game doesn't push that to its full potential. But definitely this game is worth picking up, especially if you like 2D platformers but can't keep up with the extreme difficulty that has become the fad with the revival of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045376199', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1483684146}
review: This game is a quick but clever little puzzle platformer.  I enjoyed how both the inventor and snail time mechanics played into each other.  It is a fun little game that is definitely worth a playthrough!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056049941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1483481964}
review:
Visually beautiful game. It is quite short. The story feels hacked together without that much thinking (e.g. I thought right until the end that the mysterious new Verve substance was ... a substance, not a living creature - not that it matters). I also didn't understand the need for the last puzzle involving another human - a small boy. It was completely unnecessarily cruel and I didn't see what the game, the story or even the game designers got out of putting that into the game - it's like a silly idea during brainstorming that should have been thrown out for a much better puzzle.

Overall I'd recommend it - it's a simple and enjoyable (and often hard enough) platformer with some puzzles. With graphics like these I expected more out of the other elements of the game I suppose.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013834737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1483382392}
review:
Go into the game knowing that it is very short; you will likely finish in 1-2 hours even on a first playthrough. Also go into this game knowing that it is a mashup of all the classic gaming tropes: 

- Swapping Timelines
- Stopping Time
- Abusing Magic + Technology = Doomsday Scenario
- Former Mentor Turned Evil

Overall this game is nothing spectacular; it looks nice and plays well, but aside from a giant talking snail partner, it brings nothing new to the table. If you enjoy platforming and easy-moderate puzzles, this is a good way to spend a few hours.

It's executed very well for an indie game, but be warned there are a few game breaking oversights. Do NOT drop any item into water, there is no way to retrieve it and you will be forced to start the current chapter over again. Do NOT approach the end of chapter 7 while in the "After" timeline or you will be uable to progress and will be forced to start the chapter over again.

I would recommend this to puzzle/platform lovers when it is on sale, or when it is available as part of a bundle. I'd like to see a more polished, deeper gaming experience from this developer in the future, because the ideas are there, but they need some development.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219912357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1483302336}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076061891', 'num_games_owned': 3109, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1516035436}
review:
This is a mediocre (bordering to awful) puzzle game, that looks great but have game breaking flaws and nothing special gameplaywise. There are one or two pretty clever puzzles in the game but apart from that the rest is pretty much just reusing the two most overused core mechanics from puzzle platformers (stop time and swap between worlds), and they have both been used in much better games before. The devs must also have realized that the snail would break some puzzle solutions and therefore they sometimes arbitrarly don't alow you to call her to you. 

It's also very short. I finished it at 1,8 hours acording to steam and it would have been shorter had it not been for the fact that you can permanently get stuck in a chapter and since there are no mid chapter checkpoints, you can have to replay the entire chapter again. I would guess you would finish it in about 90 minutes in a blind playthrough. Yes the chapters are very short but you shouldn't force the player to replay the entire chapter if they quit mid chapter (did this once) or if something with the game phyiscs breaks (this happend two times). But the worst of theese where when you give away your timeswapper just before the final confrontation (because reasons...) in the end of the 7th chapter, if you are in the wrong world (the current timeline) you are permanently stuck since you can't interact with anything and the platforms that you move forward with does not excist in this timeline. This is just incompetent game design, even for a 5€ game.

There are so many better games in this genre. Stay away from this tat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125664030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 381, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1482925862}
review:
通关撒花：年代记，一款横版动作解谜游戏，画风比较卡通，主角是一位白胡子老爷爷，为了阻止某个邪恶科学家的阴谋，他踏上了征途，在路上，他遇到了一只蜗牛，并与之结伴同行。

老爷爷的能力是穿梭于不同的时间节点，利用这一能力，他可以回到过去或者前进到未来。蜗牛的能力则是让时间静止到某一个时间节点上，在解决某些运动式机关的时候会起到关键作用。玩家切换老爷爷和蜗牛的4种能力，解开各种谜题，最终找到邪恶科学家。

游戏流程很短，虽然看上去有8章，但是每章只需要解决一个核心谜题就结束了，去掉挂卡时间通关只需要大约2-3小时。谜题设计还是很用心的，因为老爷爷的能力是时空穿梭，而不同的事物在不同的时间点的形态是不一样的，老爷爷还可以带着物体穿梭。

更为巧妙的是，蜗牛的能力也并不仅仅被用来静止一些杀伤性机关，对炮弹的滞空效果会让炮弹成为一个可落脚点。另外，场景里的人物活动同时静止容易被忽视但在关键时刻又会成为破解谜题的关键，菲菲好几次卡关都是因为没有重视小蜗牛，特此提醒。

由于游戏是小作坊出品，因此一些判定不是很合理，偶尔还会出现BUG，遇到这种情况不用慌张，利用穿梭时空能力让老爷爷死掉重来即可。复活点基本就是当前位置，不需要重头再来。游戏采用自动存档机制，因此玩家尽量打完一章再关闭游戏，反正不长。

场景互动基本都有提示，玩家要做的就是找到这些互动点，同时根据物体在不同时间点的形态差异，来推断过关方法。每种可拾取的物品都是有用的，如果暂时看不出怎么用就多走走，来回切换一下时间点，不要着急。

本作对操作的要求并不高，最后一小段路不能使用任何能力，但是很短，坚持过去就是胜利。总体来说是一款比较休闲的游戏，由于流程比较短，推荐打折或者入包时购买。

author: {'steamid': '76561198153985977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482724581}
review:
一款清新动人的游戏。英文量不多不是很难。

闪光点：
流程不长很轻快，解谜难度适中。
音乐太赞，好喜欢这种轻快的嗒嗒声。
场景画风在过去和未来间变幻挺大对比明显，氛围很好。
老爷爷和蜗牛CP：）简直太有爱，两个声优也选的很好。
人物及其动态做的很细致，NPC虽然话不多，性格表现挺明显。

小问题：
关卡主要以环境区分，玩法有些单一。
部分谜题设计没有提示可能会卡关。
情节展开有点仓促了。老爷爷和蜗牛关系的变化有些突兀。
关卡间也没什么起伏。最终关和其他关卡区分度不大略平淡。

两年前的游戏现在才玩到，偶尔换换口味还是挺开心的。
Love this game ❤❤❤
Hope we all have a bright future.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197999509997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1482193819}
review:
This is a really nice game, it's currently (time of writing) on offer as part of a bundle for £3.01, it's worth it. The game is short around 3 hrs and I finished the game, take in to account I stopped halfway to make food/drink etc so this could easily be done in 2hrs. 

The game has a nice story, loved the main character but the snail got a little annoying. The puzzles are a bit on the easy side. The game uses a similar mechanic to Giana Sisters: Twisted Dreams, instead of swiching between dream worlds  you switch between the past and the present, you also have the ability to pause time.

My main gripe is that the game had a few bugs some objects would disappear when being carried, to get past the load screens I had to tab out and tab back in, dialogue would sometimes repeat.

If you can get passed the few gripes I have it's worth a try. I got this game as part of the jingle jam2016.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083490861', 'num_games_owned': 1461, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1482109641}
review: It's as timey wimey as it gets. My favorite part of this little game is when I break old geezer's leg in his childhood. Meh, he's a minor character anyway and sacrifice was needed in order to save the world. I can't help but compare Chronology to The Silent Age (another timey wimey game), and in my mind a game like that shouldn't be too easy like The Silent Age. Chronology has everything: good puzzles, rememberable characters, sacrfices, anti-hero and a deadbeat villain.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963852020', 'num_games_owned': 4348, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1482102778}
review:
Plataformas en 2D donde nos presentan una serie de desafíos basados en la manipulación del tiempo a través de 2 personajes jugables.
El juego es bastante fácil en los retos que nos plantean y no nos supondrá pasarnos el juego en unas 2 o 3 horas.
El diseño artístico cumple con creces y mas cuando nos quieren mostrar el paso del tiempo entre escenarios y acompañado de una buena BSO.

Si quieres desconectar de tanto juego AAA durante unas horas y llevarte una grata sorpresa, compralo y disfrutalo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067444037', 'num_games_owned': 895, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1484185601}
review:
I have so much love for this game and I've only played it for an hour or so! It has so many incredible mechanics, also I love time travel so this was right up my street! Chronology has an interesting plot and generally pretty good voice acting too. I'd heartily recommend this game to anyone unsure. I got the game as part of the Jingle Jam by donating (https://www.humblebundle.com/yogscast-jingle-jam).

I've decided to do a pull playthrough of this amazing game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GXGwFAqNFzM&list=PLySWle9ZKHFhWj6O1PfH3hapblV1e7MlI&index=20

author: {'steamid': '76561198229983852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1481680120}
review: Apesar de muito rápido, Chronology é extremamente divertido. Uma boa história, personagens cativantes e com um visual muito legal, puzzles bem balanceados e criativos, para não falar dos cenários lindos, em ambos passado e futuro. Sem dúvida vale a compra

author: {'steamid': '76561198031313794', 'num_games_owned': 8531, 'num_reviews': 3393, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1481576298}
review:
[h1]Описание:[/h1]
Платформер-головоломка. Мы играем за старого ученого, который с помощью машины времени решил изменить мрачный и разрушенный мир, в такой каким он помнил его когда-то - живой, красочный, спокойный. Отправляясь в путешествие мы знакомимся с говорящей улиткой, способной останавливать время. С таким набором способностей нам не страшны любые преграды и мы с надоедливым другом отправляемся в опасное и интересное путешествие.

[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
¥ Великолепная анимация, рисовка, декорации.
¥ Отличный саундтрек.
¥ Игра на русском языке (субтитры).
¥ Интересные для выполнения загадки.
¥ Удобное управление (на джойстике удобнее, но и на клаве все на уровне).
¥ Сочетание простого понятного всем юмора с глубокими мыслями о бытие.
¥ Каждый уровень красив и неповторим.

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
¥ Один баг из-за которого пришлось проходить предпоследний уровень (во время передачи часов времени улитке нажал на возвращение в прошлое и после этого ничего вернуть было нельзя, как и проходить дальше),
¥ Нет достижений.
¥ Нет никаких пасхалок, скрытых мест или каких-то других бонусов.
¥ Слабый, скомканный сюжет.
¥ В игре очень мало уровней.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]
Начиналось все просто на уровне АХ и ОХ. Красивый мир, музыка, геймплей... Движемся вперед, узнаем историю, начинаем любить окружающий мир... А потом игра кончается... Продолжительность прохождения уж слишком маленькая, тут как минимум в два раза больше уровней надо... Ну да ладно... Чего нет того нет. А то, что есть оцениваю положительно.

[h1]Оценка: 8/10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]
Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в группу
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256930117', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1478385389}
review: Chronology est un petit jeu sans ambition qui vous fera passer une à deux bonnes heures. Mais pour être parfaitement honnête je vous conseille d'attendre des petites soldes steam pour qu'un achat soit vraiment rentable. ( même si ça reste un divertissement correct pour 5 euros).

author: {'steamid': '76561198243245954', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1477693543}
review:
Игра хорошая . Сюжет интересный . Головоломки не очень сложные ( не отбивают интерес ).

author: {'steamid': '76561198133522398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1461957522}
review: Chronology aurait pu être un très bon jeu mais finalement il manque beaucoup trop de profondeur. Tout est convenu, les énigmes, la pseudo-histoire les personnages. Même la fin trop abrupte pour réellement être intéressante s'inscrit dans la ligée de ce jeu beaucoup trop court. Je l'ai refait plusieurs fois dans l'espoir de découvrir des secrets et peut-être des fins alternatives mais le jeu est désespérement vide de contenu autant que d'intérêt. Dommage l'idée du jeu temporelle était bon au départ. à oublier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164382571', 'num_games_owned': 1104, 'num_reviews': 422, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1473105951}
review:
[i][b]Chronology[/b][/i] est un puzzle-game à mi-chemin entre les manipulations temporelles de [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/26800/][i][b]Braid[/b][/i][/url] et l'ambiance un poil steampunk de [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/249590/][i][b]Teslagrad[/b][/i][/url]. Oui, bon... je le reconnais volontiers... j'ai eu la main [strike]assez[/strike] très lourde sur la comparaison. En réalité, il ne joue clairement pas dans la même catégorie, la faute à un manque cruel d'ambition.
 
L'histoire est plutôt rudimentaire, rien que de très classique pour ce genre de jeu. En gros, vous devez sauver le monde. Pour cela, vous disposez de deux aptitudes : arrêter le temps (et donc tout ce qui se trouve en mouvement) ou bien naviguer entre deux époques (avant et après, que sépare un certain nombre d'années, avec toutes les répercussions qu'on imagine).

Techniquement, ce n'est pas toujours très... propre, en particulier au niveau des sauts. Malgré tout, le graphisme est agréable, la difficulté très abordable (deux ou trois énigmes mises à part, et encore) et donc la durée de vie pour le moins courte. A peu de choses près, comptez deux heures pour le boucler. Pour sa défense, il affiche un prix des plus honnête.

Bref, [i][b]Chronology[/b][/i] est un puzzle-game sympathique, mais hélas sans grande prétention.

[h1]Verdict : 3/5 - Ce qui est assez bien, mais pas top.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198058895396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1472940072}
review: I don't write reviews quite often but I need to write some of my remarks on why I abandon playing this game for this game lacks common sense. -Spoiler warning- I liked the first parts, cool graphics etc. But when I reach to the city, it was a terrible experience, I thought old whimsical adventure games came back to haunt me again. The part that you want to get a ticket to ride the elevator is a complete bullcrap. This game is a good example of needing talent to create story driven puzzle games. Nonsensical puzzles are far more frustrating that any bugs you can encounter within any game. Anyway I am going to give this a thumbs up but not that I liked the game but for the efforts they put into creating it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044953811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1467802158}
review:
[h1]Verändere die Zukunft![/h1]

Chronology ist ein knuffiges kleines Game, das wirklich zu empfehlen ist.
Als alter Mann macht man sich auf den Weg, seinen Meister davor aufzuhalten eine ganze Stadt auszurotten.
Auf diesem "epischem" Abenteuer, begleitet Euch eine kleine Schnecke, die ebenfalls aus dieser Stadt kam.
Darüber ist der alte Mann zwar nicht sonderlich erfreut, da die Schnecke zwar nervig für den alten Herrn ist, aber auch nützlich.
Gelingt es Euch also, den Ablauf der Zeit zu verändern?

[h1]Positive Aspekte:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Nette Grafik.
[*]Schöne Musik die sehr gut zum Spiel dazu passt.
[*]Steam-Sammelkarten.
[*]Das Spiel hat zwar volle Controllerunterstützung, ist aber auch genauso gut auf der Tastatur spielbar.
[*]Schöne Screenshotvorlagen.
[/list]

Das war es eigentlich schon im großen und ganzen... 
Diese wenigen positiven Aspekte sollen aber nicht zeigen, dass das Spiel schlecht ist, im Gegenteil.

[h1]Die negativen Aspekte wären:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Kurze Spielzeit.(Je nach Spieler positiver/neutraler Aspekt, mich hat's nicht gestört.)
[*]Keine Errungenschaften.(Siehe oben, kommt ebenfalls auf den Spieler drauf an.)
[*]Recht "hoher" Kaufpreis für max. 2 Stunden Spielzeit.
[*]Kein Wiederspielwert.
[/list]

[b]Mit anderen Worten, stören würde mich eigentlich nur der Kaufpreis.
Mir hat das Spiel echt gut gefallen und ich hatte es auch nach knapp 2 Stunden durch, die restliche Zeit die gerade oben drauf kommt, entsteht nur noch wegen den Kartenfunden. :)
Sollte das Spiel also mal im Sale sein für ca. 0,99ct oder gar billiger, würde ich es auf jedenfall empfehlen, sofern Euch das Genre gefällt.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198198915626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1487771672}
review:
Petit jeu de plateforme / casse-tête très beau et intelligent ! 
Les graphismes sont certes simples mais très colorés et variés.
Il est établi sous forme de chapitres très diverses dans lesquels vous devez évoluer en gravitant, tantôt dans le présent, tantôt dans le passé, pour avancer.
Les transitions passé/présent sont très fluides.
Je recommande ! Les joueurs, comme moi,  nostalgiques des 90's adventure games y retrouveront les sensations et les émotions de nos  jeux d'antan !
<3

author: {'steamid': '76561198063552352', 'num_games_owned': 2891, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1474433167}
review: 这游戏真是太棒了，作为解谜游戏洗玩起来非常的爽快，时间更替的画面差也总给人难以言表的触动，刚玩了一关，但相信剧情也不会让大家失望的，极度推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198067382995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1466687095}
review:
As much as I liked this game, I have to say I am really disappointed by its length. Took me 2 hours to finish it and that's pretty much all there is to it, as there's no replayability whatsoever.

Also, one of the puzzles requires you to cripple a kid/man for life. I know that this is a video game and the characters are fictional, but seriously? That's pretty mean for a protagonist who's trying to save the world from destruction, if you asked me.

Still, Chronology is a solid and colorful platformer with a clever use of the time traveling concept. While controlling the snail, you can also stop time, but I honestly feel it's not used much throughout the game.

I will recommend this game, but I'm not sure about its price tag. It's not that 4,99€ is a lot of money; it's just that I've played many similar puzzle/platformer games with the same price tag that took me a lot longer to finish. Maybe get it while on a discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041512403', 'num_games_owned': 1837, 'num_reviews': 2464, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1464955781}
review:
과거와 현재를 오가면서 펼치는 퍼즐 게임
챕터 1~5까지는 난이도도 쉽고 그렇게 어렵지 않게 클리어 할 수 있지만,
챕터6의 장미꽃 부분에서 막히게 된다.

초기에는 간단하게 풀 수 있으니 별로 못 느끼지만,
6레벨부터 게임에 도움말 또는 힌트 시스템이 없는 것이 조금 아쉬웠다.
물론  찾아가는 재미라고 할 수 있지만....
짜증내면서 끄려다가 공략 영상보고 클리어 성공

마지막 챕터는 그냥 보너스 챕터라고 생각하겠다.
점프가 힘들다는 어려움도 존재.

마지막으로 말하자면 떠나도 다시 돌아온 친우
달팽이 최고!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198022458781', 'num_games_owned': 2808, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1464122036}
review:
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40165899]Curatore in lingua italiana[/url]

Il difetto di questo gioco è la sua brevità: a tal riguardo colgo l'occasione per osservare che quando ha introdotto la rimborsabilità dei suoi giochi, Steam non ha considerato che esistono giochi che si finiscono prima delle famose due ore dopo le quali si elargiscono le carte. Uno di questi è Chronology. Detto questo, il resto delle caratteristiche del gioco sono in massima parte positive. Chronology è un gioco di puzzle/piattaforme dai bei fondali, con una dinamica di gioco stimolante, e un duo di personaggi che per quel poco che si gioca riescono a essere vivi divertendoci. La colonna sonora dei titoli di coda è notevole. Consigliato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096178450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1463079776}
review:
Being a lover of Platformers, Time Travel, and Indie games, I knew that I had to pick this one up when I finally discovered it.
It's a simple platform game but the puzzles involved make very challenging at times.
I have to say what I loved the most about this game was the art. I found it beautiful and I loved how detailed everything is for a 2d game. The soundtrack was a nice background to the whole game. I really liked the song they used during the credits. I think the only downside to this game is how short it is. I would have loved to continue playing, I had a lot of fun and there were quite a few chuckles to be had over the commentary between the two characters. 
All in all it's a decent price but if you can get it on sale like I did, then it is a game I highly recommend you pick up.

review:
If you are looking for a quick, short, fun, clever puzzle/platformer, this might be for you. This game took me about 3 hours to complete. I was already at Chapter 4 (out of 8) 45 minutes in.

Pros:
- Beautiful art
- I really like the protagonist's voice
- Snail mechanics

For 5 bucks.... boy, I don't know. I'd say it's worth it. This isn't a MUST PLAY game, but if you're looking for a quick puzzle/platformer, I think this is perfect.
3/5

review: Chronology zamanda yolculuk yapabilen bir mucit ve onun salyangoz arkadaşıyla birlikte yaşadığı maceraları anlatıyor. Oyun kısa 8 bölümden meydana gelmekte. Basit, anlaşılır ve akıcı bir bulmaca oyunu. Sizi zorlamıyor ve yormuyor. Zamanınızı basit ve hoş bir şekilde geçirmek istiyorsanız oynayabileceğiniz bir oyun. Eğer çocuğunuz var ise ve ona bir oyun alacaksanız mutlaka almanız gereken bir oyun olarak tavsiye ederim. Oyun bağımsız yapımcı olduğu için parasını fazlası ile hak etmekte.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976999134', 'num_games_owned': 3259, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1457487160}
review:
Nice graphics. Decent gameplay. Mediocre plot. I accidently trapped myself twice by jumping into an area that I assume was supposed to be inaccesible.

Mostly puzzle based platforming until the last level and then it switches to skill based. The game feels like a long tutorial especially since it took only about 2 hours to finish.

Main reason I wrote this review is to point out how horrible the protaganist is. He is mean to the snail constantly even though the snail saves his life multiple times. Also, to progress at one point I was forced to cripple a child for life in order to steal his cane as an adult in order to grab a hook that was out of reach. The old guy I steal it from even has his entire life perspective changed as a result. Before breaking the kid's leg, his adult self was grateful for the home and his life. After, he blamed the house for a miserable life. I actually tried to find an alternate solution because I felt so terrible.

TLDR: Pretty, short, and I didnt understand the moral of the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202987197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1456241392}
review: Ein schönes Spiel, mit einer schönen Grafik und einer tollen, leider zu kurzen Geschichte. Die Rätsel sind am Anfang gut zu durchschauen, werden aber im laufe des Spiels immer kniffliger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137432313', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1455878119}
review:
Chronology - это небольшая игра в жанре платформер. Игроку нужно бегать, прыгать и решать несложные загадки, основанные на остановке времени и переключением между двумя мирами - настоящим и прошлым. Реализовано все перечисленное хорошо, поэтому скучать вам не придется. Остальные плюсы перечислю ниже.

+ Отличная рисованная графика, не отягощенная лишними эффектами, блумом и прочей нечистью
+ Юмор и персонажи
+ Игра хорошо играется как на клавиатуре, так и на геймпаде (тестировал на паде от 360 бокса)
+ Есть русский перевод субтитрами, они хорошо видны
+ Есть карточки

Из минусов можно назвать маленькую продолжительность и простоту. Любителям хардкора проходить мимо. Остальным рекомендуется оценить.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025267880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1455505039}
review:
This is a cute little game with a cute little mechanic of manipulating time. It's a puzzle-platformer where you can go back and forth in time to two periods, one before a disaster and one after. You have a friendly snail companion to help you jump to otherwise unreachable locations.The story is minimal, but decent. Think a slimmed down version of Bastion's story with an extremely rudimentary version of Braid and that's Chronology.

Pros:
+Decent story
+Good music
+Interesting mechanic

Neutral:
~ Okay art
~ Voice acting wasn't fantastic
~ Snail companion was too cute to give the story any weight. I get the tie in with time and snails (ha ha) but it's just...too cute.

Cons:
-Extremely short. I spent 2 hours and there were several times when I wasted a good 5-10 minutes wandering around trying to figure out a couple of puzzles because they weren't obvious. I could have done with more over everything: more puzzles, more story, more anything.

Overall: 8/10. Nothing fantastic, but different enough to be enjoyable. Don't buy at full price, even though it's cheap to begin with. Worth the $3 I paid for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011595325', 'num_games_owned': 2476, 'num_reviews': 929, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1455405379}
review:
Chronology é mais um game do estilo plataforma, mas ele também é único, mesmo tendo uma estória simples a ambientação do jogo e a mecânica de viagem no tempo acabam o tornando especial, a arte também é bela e os puzzles únicos. O único real defeito que posso apontar neste jogo é a duração, acho que terminei com 4 horas na primeira vez, isso enrolando um pouco. Vale a pena, principalmente em promoção.
-------------------------------------
Chronology is another platform game, but it is also unique, even though a simple story the setting of the game and the time trip mechanics end up making it special, art is also beautiful and puzzles unique. The only real fault I can point is the length, I think I finished with 4 hours the first time, thats lingering a little. Worth it, especially on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025779198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1455041128}
review:
Chronology es un videojuego en 2D que mezcla plataformas y puzles. Nos pone en la piel de un inventor que viaja al pasado para evitar que una tragedia destroce su ciudad. Los cambios entre el pasado y el presente se ejecutan tan solo pulsando un botón y modificar el pasado, para que esos cambios alteren el presente es la base principal de los puzles que plantea.

Pros:
- Los puzles y sus mecánicas, muy interesantes.
- El apartado visual está muy logrado.

Contras:
- Demasiado corto y no ofrece nada para rejugarlo.
- El control es algo tosco.

Conclusión: Chronology es un buen juego de puzles que peca sobretodo en su duración. Si ofreciera logros o algo que lo hiciese rejugable aun se podría perdonar, pero sin nada de ello su duración es demasiado escasa. Para los que no os importe su duración os lo recomiendo, pues sus mecánicas son interesantes. Para los que dos horas se os hagan demasiado cortas solo lo podría recomendar estando en oferta.

Puntuación: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197980993256', 'num_games_owned': 3109, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1454517277}
review:
Chronology es otro juego que se tira a la enorme piscina de juegos indie de puzles y plataformas, cuyo éxito depende directamente del número de títulos que hayas jugado del género. Sin ser un mal juego, le falta ingenio y chispa por todas partes, además de duración -en algo más de una hora se habrá acabado-. Extremadamente simple para un juego de este tipo, pero está lejos de ser un mal juego y además tiene un apartado técnico por encima de la media, lo cual ameniza el corto viaje.

Análisis completo de Chronology en El BloJ
[url]http://elblojdeneojin.blogspot.com.es/2016/01/chronology.html[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198061926521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1442410467}
review:
Juego muy resultón pero demasiado fácil y corto. Tan corto que para sacar todos sus cromos tendré que "idlear" porque me lo he acabado y aún no me han dado ni un solo cromo.

Es una lástima que parezca que el concepto jugable esté desaprovechado por su corta duración y la baja dificultad de sus niveles. Niveles más complejos y con alguna nueva habilidad subiría la calidad del título. Parece como si hubieran terminado de forma prematura el desarrollo del juego.

Aún así recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198222910320', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1431557485}

Si lo ves en oferta, dále una oportunidad.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198076212741', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1409853844}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042838346', 'num_games_owned': 5512, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1498252843}
review:
Chronology est un court puzzle-platformer dans lequel vous devrez manipuler le temps afin de sauver le présent.

Vous incarnez un vieil inventeur qui veut tenter d'empêcher la destruction du monde survenue après l'invention d'une machine très puissante.

Le gameplay est simple : vous vous servez d'une montre spéciale afin de jongler entre le passé d'avant la catastrophe et le présent désolé. Cette mécanique de jeu vous permettra de faire apparaitre des plateformes comme des arbres dans le présent ou des maisons dans le passé. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=495728020 Lors des premiers chapitres du jeu la progression se fait sans heurts, on avance assez rapidement jusqu'à rencontrer un escargot. Ce dernier offrira de plus grandes possibilités de puzzles grâce à son pouvoir de figer le temps. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=495728312 Ce pouvoir sera utile pour ralentir des plateformes, passer au travers de certains pièges ou encore pour actionner des leviers puis se déplacer sans que le mécanisme ne s'arrête. L'escargot sera aussi indispensable pour effectuer certains sauts puisqu'on pourra se placer sur son dos pour se rapprocher des plateformes. Il pourra aussi boucher des tuyaux crachant de la fumée ou des effluves toxiques afin de laisser notre inventeur passer etc...

Dans la seconde partie du jeu les puzzles deviennent plus intéressants, plus exigeants, sans être insurmontables. La réflexion sera au rendez-vous et il faudra jouer avec l'environnement autant qu'avec ses pouvoirs.

Scénaristiquement Chronology ne fait pas preuve de beaucoup d'originalité, il faudra simplement sauver le monde en arrêtant un savant fou. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=495728113 On aura droit à quelques cinématiques dessinées à la main entre chaque niveaux, appréciables mais elles ne laissent pas un souvenir impérissable.

Les graphismes du jeu sont jolis, ses couleurs chatoyantes se rapprochent de celles d'un dessin animé avec des personnages attachants. Les quelques voix qui se feront entendre sont bien doublées elles-aussi et bien qu'il s'agisse d'un petit jeu on aura droit à des sous-titres français de bonne qualité.

En bref Chronology est un jeu vraiment sympathique dont l'intérêt réside principalement dans son gameplay et ses puzzles bien pensés. Vous auriez bien 2h-2h30 à lui consacrer ?

[quote]Lisez d'autres avis sur ma page de curation : [b][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9002662/]Kitsune's Guide[/url][/b][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198024648513', 'num_games_owned': 1211, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1469195571}
review: Nem túl hosszú, 2,2 óra alatt (ha hinni lehet a Steam időmérésének) végigjátszottam és nagyon jól szórakoztam. Elég logikus, néhány kicsit idegesítő ügyességi résztől eltekintve nagyon klassz játék volt. Először telefonon találkoztam vele, bár csak az első 2-3 pályás free verzióval, de megjegyzem, azért billentyűzettel ezerszer egyszerűbb volt az irányítás :) A grafika szép, gyerekeknek is ajánlható, mert szinte semmi erőszak nincs benne. (SPOILER!!! Kivéve mikor a kissrác eltöri a lábát a hetedik pályán.) És amit még mindenképpen kiemelnék a gyönyörű, rajzolt grafikán kívül, az a hangok és a zene. Le a kalappal ismét Skandinávia előtt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075898326', 'num_games_owned': 2036, 'num_reviews': 268, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1423870177}
review:
Nie lubię aż tak słodkich i bajkowych klimatów, dlatego gra utknęła w mojej bibliotece "przypadkiem" (tiaaa, promocja) i również przypadkiem została zainstalowana. Okazało się jednak, że ocena "Bardzo pozytywne" nie jest przesadzona, a gra choć wygląda na prostą i dla dzieci, zmusza wielokrotnie do myślenia i kombinowania.

W grze wcielamy się w krasnoluda, który ma amnezję. Ląduje w znanej sobie okolicy, ale strasznie zniszczonej, jakby minęły lata od jego nieobecności. Po chwili orientuje się, że może manipulować czasem i cofać go o  parę? paręnaście? lat wstecz. Więc przeszkody musimy pokonywać wykorzystując tą umiejętność i pamiętając, że jak zrobimy coś w przeszłosci, w przyszłości okolica będzie wyglądała inaczej. Czasem też dopiero szybkie przełączanie miedzy przeszłością i przyszłością pozwala na przeskoczenie z punktu A do B, bo w żadnym czasie nie ma wystarczającej liczby elementów. Potem robi się jeszcze ciekawiej. Dołącza do nas bowiem ślimak, który może powstrzymywać niektóre pułapki i zatrzymywać czas. 

Wbrew pozorom, choć niektóre zadania są dość złożonę, grę można przejść w ciągu około 2 godzin. Nie jest irytująco trudno, jest tylko jak łamigłówka, którą trzeba rozwiązywać raz, za razem. 

Fajna odskocznia od platformówek pełnych samej akcji i bieganiny. Jednak nie jest to gra, którą pokochałam. Była fajna, ale nic więcej. Nie powala na kolana, nie zaskakuje, nie wniesie nic szczególnego do Waszego życia poza dumą z przejścia kolejnej gry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119758010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1434265992}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971058395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1428196094}

author: {'steamid': '76561197984794864', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1428035807}
review: Хорошая идея, приятная музыка, симпотичная графика. Скучные и слабые головоломки, отвратительное управление. Очень жаль. Хотя детям должна понравиться.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961349980', 'num_games_owned': 750, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1426360742}
review:
I really liked the way how puzzles were made but this game was way too short. It felt like playing a demo or beta version because it only took about 2h to finish and I wasn't even rushing it through.

[b]Plusplus:[/b]

+ Nice graphics
+ Awesome puzzles (and mechanics)

[b]Minusminus:[/b]

- SHORT
- After jumping character freezes for like 1 ms but it's long enough to take away from that smoothiness from gameplay.
- I don't think you were able to skip videos. (not sure about this)
- Absolutely zero replay value if you play in near future.
- Story (At least for me it was super boring.)


I had really hard time to decide should I recommend this but I guess I'm just gonna do it because I really liked those puzzles and mechanics they were build upon and that weights a lot in these kinds of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090345125', 'num_games_owned': 2242, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1427125807}
review: Приятный и добрый пазл с элементами платформера, простой как три копейки, но, что-то затягивает хотя и все линейно и коротко да и боссов не завезли, но за концепт и визуальный стиль пожалуй можно поставить твердую 4-ку, рекоммендую - особенно если по скидке или в составе бандла.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966720521', 'num_games_owned': 3409, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1427055242}
review:
Un plataformas en 2d cuyo aspecto jugable se centra en la manipulación del tiempo, alterando elementos del pasado, el futuro, o incluso deteniendo el propio tiempo según nos convenga. Me sorprendió la originalidad de este sistema, aunque seguramente se podría y me habría gustado que se explotara aún más con más niveles, ya que la duración actual es de poco más de 2-3 horas.

No obstante me ha gustado mucho todo el diseño artístico, y la historia aún siendo breve es bastante acorde con el resto de cosas. En general los puzzles no son complicados, siempre y cuando no olvides las habilidades que se te proporcionan para resolverlos.

Solo encontré algún fallo visual menor sin gran importancia.

Si estás saturado de experiencias que ofrecen infinitas horas de duración y buscas algo relativamente sencillo, corto, a la vez que entretenido, este juego puede ajustarse muy bien a ello. Su precio base es decente para lo que ofrece, y si además lo encuentras de oferta ni me lo pensaría.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998640886', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1426331406}
review: No matter how short it is, it's actually a fun puzzle platformer with unique mechanic worth to try. Some people say it's childish, maybe they're right, still, it has enough challange to anyone for a relaxing gaming. Also i didn't expected an end credit song like this from a game like this, i liked it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041093974', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1425514148}
review: Só compre se for 75% off por ai, jogo muito bacana, varios puzzle foda, alguns tem que quebrar a cabeça mesmo... mais campanha bem pequena então por isso não vale muito, com 2 horas ~ 3 horas você completa tudo...  Muito bacana a ideia de tempo passando entre o passado e o futuro, até mesmo congelando o tempo, jogo feito com amor é outro nivel <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198205216164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1426786884}
review: This game is really neat, I just haven't had the time to getting around to playing it more. I enjoy the element of the time manipulation it definitely felt unique in that aspect.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 1009, 'num_reviews': 689, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1424986014}
review: Not a bad game, and certainly better than most of the puzzle platformers I've played recently (looking at you Logigun and Gateways). It it super short, only about 2 hours. The art and music are nice. I honestly couldn't tell you what the story was about, as it was pretty bare-bones, not captivating, and didn't make much sense. The voices of the characters are not fitting, especially the snail, which sounds like an 5 year old boy for some reason. There are multiple bugs. Items you have to use get stuck on your snail and you cannot pick them back up, making progressing impossible. This problem is furthered by the fact that there are no save points, if you quit the level you have to do the entire thing over. Luckily levels arent that long. Another big is sometimes things that should be interactable aren't, leaving you to spend some time switching time and hoping that it fixes itself. The other biggest problem is with puzzles. While many are cool and intuitive and make nice use of mechanics, some make no sense. Most of the time it's because you didn't know that object that looked to be part of the background was interactable. In one instance you're supposed to know that a light in the background can be jumped next to and that causes it to be knocked down, even though that's never happened before in the game, and there are other similar looking lights in the room but one is just usable for no reason. Usually when I looked up solutions I thought "well how was I supposed to know I could use that, or that it would do that to that object, that has never happened earlier in the game and that's not reall reasonable", or "that looks like the background". Also the platforming isn't that great, as your guy moves super slowly and jumping feels like he has lead weights tied around both ankles. Most of the jumps you have to make take multiple tries and you may just BARELY make one time even though you were standing on the very end of the ledge, and you just barely landed only half way on the other ledge. All in all its a cute fun little game. Wish the puzzles made more sense or were more obvious that what you had to do was even an option. 6.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039667295', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1424619531}
review:
Chronology é um dos jogos mais meigos que já joguei.

Simples, divertido e com um charme próprio, o jogo continua divertido do começo ao fim.

O único problema é que é muito curto, mas esse problema é definitivamente ignorado por seu preço baixo, possuindo assim um custo/benefício maravilhoso.

Pra quem gostou de Braid e Limbo e é apaixonado por indie games, Chronology é altamente indicado.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981557797', 'num_games_owned': 5234, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1424140212}
review: Although really brief, this was a surprisingly well done puzzle platformer.  It only takes about 90 minutes to play through; but the hand-drawn looking art style and time mechanic really make things interesting.  I did find the snails voice to be somewhat irritating; but thankfully she didn't talk too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993456879', 'num_games_owned': 2478, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1422124355}
review:
Chronology, zamanda yolculuk yapmayı bulmuş bir mucidi kontrol ettiğimiz platform/bulmaca oyunu.

Zaman içerisinde geçmişe ve geleceğe giderek önümüzdeki engelleri küçük salyangozumuz Snail'in de yardımıyla aşarak ilerlediğimiz bir oyun var karşımızda. Üstelik yaşlı karakterimizin bu zaman sıçramalarını yapımcı bize oldukça şirin grafiklerle sunmayı başarmış. Geçmiş ve günümüzün arasında gidip-geldiğimiz oyunda, bu iki zamanın mekanları ne denli değiştirdiğini tecrübe etmek de çok keyif verici.

Yanımızdaki salyangozumuz Snail'e gerçekten ayrı bir parargaf açmak gerekir. Zamanı durdurabilmesinin yanında, nesneleri manipule etme gibi çok yardımı dokunan özellikleri var. Ayrıca çok şirin seslere ve ifadelere sahip! Yol boyunca sıkı bir arkadaş ve bizi yalnızlığımızdan kurtarıyor.

Oyun tüm bu güzelliklerine rağmen sadece 8 kısa bölümden oluşuyor. Ayrıca bulmacalar çok da zor değil ve hikaye de biraz klişe sanki...

Ufak tefek eksikliklerine rağmen Chronology sıkılmadan oynanabilen bir platform/bulmaca oyunu olmuş. 

Puanım: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198042584429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1422117692}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068556222', 'num_games_owned': 2100, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1422048541}
review:
öncelikle Snail(sümüklü böcek) olan dostunla hikayeye atılıyorsunuz yeri gelince birbirinize yardım ederek bölümlerde zorlanmadan geçebiliyorsunuz sadece hangi görevde kimin yapacağını düşünmeniz gerek yeri geldiğinde de diğer yaşam gibi yere geçiyorsunuz oralarda da kullanabileceğiniz geçişler bulabiliyorsunuz ayrıca diğer platform oyunları gibi zorluğu yok oynarken sinirlenmeyip zevk alıyorsunuz hikayede kısa olmuş 4 saate kadar bitirmiş oluyorsunuz..

author: {'steamid': '76561198078143581', 'num_games_owned': 3295, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1421954688}
review:
Chronology es un juego encantador. Sus personajes, su estética, su historia, su banda sonora, su sentido del humor… todo ayuda a conseguir el magnífico clima donde se desarrolla la aventura. A lo largo de sus ocho capítulos iremos con el inventor y su amigo caracol avanzando a través de bosques y ciudades, manejando los distintos escenarios en dos realidades diferentes: el horrible presente y el esperanzador pasado. Gracias a ésta habilidad podremos acceder a aquellos lugares que parecen inaccesibles, cambiar el aspecto de un escenario o incluso el comportamiento de un personaje secundario.

Como dicen otros analistas, se trata de un juego corto (a mi me ha durado unas tres horas, pero se puede hacer en menos). Es un juego muy sencillo en términos generales; además, la acción pausada permite al jugador deleitarse con los escenarios y las interacciones de los personajes.

El único fallo que le veo es la existencia de dos o tres bugs (no encontré más) que, en el peor de los casos, te obligan a reiniciar el nivel. No es un gran problema porque son niveles cortos y, una vez descubierto como avanzar, se hace rápido. Pero sí es un poco molesto. Sin embargo, se trata de un pequeño pecado que se le perdona con gusto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083774673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1422019800}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048092359', 'num_games_owned': 1702, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1421242984}
review:
Chronology is a short puzzle platformer with an emphasis on short and puzzle. At times it feels more like a point and click adventure than a platformer, in fact the only time i got stuck in the game was in one of the "point and clicky parts" with the  toothache plant. Despite getting stuck for 20 minutes I finished the game in just a little over an hour.

The controls are fine, although they could be improved. In some of the puzzles you have to switch between the characters and use their special time manipulating abilites, it would be nice if you could control the snail and the inventor at the same time or at least use 2 different buttons for their abilites.

The story is told as you solve the puzzles and is really straightforward, the game seems suitable for children.

Overall it was a short but nice little experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086290545', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1421340292}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004406947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1421160841}
review:
Chronology is a platform game that grants you the ability to manipulate time. Its worthy of being purchased by all fans of puzzle games. You start adventuring as an old man and are soon joined by a young snail. You will need to switch between those both characters with different abilities. The old man can change time to future and present, the snail can stop time. You can take different items to combine them in different times. The Puzzles arent really complicated.

Now the negative about it: I guess the game isnt tested very well because it happens that i take steps which werent meant to be like this on one part it was impossible to continue the game with what i did. Sometimes it didnt trigger the events and i was running around for long times till i looked up a walkthrough and figured out that the game is just not working. One Part in Chapter 6..i couldnt pick up the flower anymore to give it to the old Lady. It needed 2 chapter restarts till it finally worked. Another Part was by fixing the saw..it didnt combine the 2 Parts..so another Chapter restart. Next Part in Chapter 7 i jump up to the Hook and it wont fall down after around 50 Jumps and restarting the chapter and replay everything i gave up..till im on another computer and see how it is working there. And Blackscreens by some videos sequences.

Still i recommend this game it has nice mechanics and a good idea. The Price is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992512464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1420898961}
review:
Un juego de puzzles y plataformas, muy bonito visualmente pero extremadamente corto, 8 capitulos acabados en 2 horas. 
Buena historia, comenzando con una catastrofe y "amnesia" del protagonista, poco a poco irá descubriendo qué pasó y cómo solucionarlo.
En cuanto a lo del control del tiempo, se trata de que el escenario varía en función si se está en el tiempo actual o en el pasado, de esta forma es posble solucionar los diferentes puzzles.

Recomendable si se tiene la oportunidad de pillarlo de oferta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047059101', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1419881472}
review:
Chronology présente tout d'abord des qualités indéniables : des graphismes magnifiques - je les aime un peu moins en "scènes cinématiques" mais c'est personnel - une bande-son correcte, voire parfois bonne, un scénario classique mais efficace et des doublages anglais agréables. L'idée du gameplay, basé sur le temps entre l'homme et la machine (enfin l'escargot), est bien trouvée et nous présume de bonnes choses.

Toutefois, si les énigmes sont bien pour des enfants - et dans ce cas, je le leur recommande, surtout en promotion - elles ne le sont pas, sauf une ou deux, pour un gamer ou un adulte avisé, si bien qu'un éventuel prix élevé serait plutôt un point négatif à son tableau. A éviter tant qu'il n'est pas en promotion.

Par ailleurs, il existe un bug assez sérieux dans le jeu - un bug de caméra existe à un moment du jeu et il faut avancer les deux personnages en même temps, l'un sur l'autre - et, surtout, Chronology se termine bien trop rapidement. Si cela n'avait pas été un cadeau, je me serai senti floué.

Bref, je le recommanderais en promotion et pour des enfants. Pour les autres, comme moi, ce jeu est à éviter pour sa durée de vie - et surtout pour cela car ses autres qualités, malgré des énigmes plutôt faciles, sont saluables.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092605574', 'num_games_owned': 1321, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1419744794}
review:
While a solid attempt, the game falls short of pretty much all accounts except one:

- Super short, ~90min to play through everything
- Time mechanic interesting but fairly repetative
- The game is designed for 7-10 year olds. While I don't take that as a negative please note that. I enjoyed Rayman a lot which may have similar auidence I found this too childish.
- The puzzles are not always very logical especially given the target auidence, platforming is straightforward and linear
- Graphics are very good and animation is what you would expect for an artsy game
- Story is decent for the short time game has to offer

If you are looking for a game for your kid then this might be a good choice. Alternatively, get it on severe discount. Otherwise, move along.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026325298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1418787852}
review:
[h1]Score: 6/10[/h1]

[b]Similar games:[/b] 
Braid, P.B. WInterbottom, and The Lost Vikings

[b]Overview[/b]
You and your former mentor found a new form of energy which eventually destroyed the world. Now it is your job to stop your old mentor by using your time shifting watch along and of course snail your newly found sidekick who you switch between when the game lets you.

[b]The Good[/b]
The best part is easily the games puzzles which have a very nice balance. I personally love the graphics of the game and it is probably what drew me in to look at it in the first place. The story is interesting enough, but won't wow you by any means.

[b]The Bad[/b]
The voice overs are quite absurd. I'm not sure if it is meant to be funny or just bad due to the budget constraints. The game isn't to glitchy, but you will notice you missing jumps you should make once in a while which can be annoying. There was at least twice where I tried a way to solve a puzzle and it failed because of this miss issue causing me to question my logic.

[b]Conclusion[/b]
The game is only about two hours long and overall it was still a pretty fun romp with tons of charm along with descent production values for an indie game without a big following.

[b]Value[/b]
If you like puzzle games I'd suggest getting it for $2.50 or less.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022997080', 'num_games_owned': 2142, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1418697416}
review:
Chronology doesn't seem to know what it wants to be, or how to go about expressing whatever it eventually decides on.

It's a puzzle platformer in appearance, but more akin to a point and click adventure game in structure. Time manipulation is introduced as the driving mechanic but then barely used in any interesting way, or completely forgotten for more tired adventure and platforming standards. There's this setup to an involving time travel narrative that's rather quickly exchanged for the dull relationship building between your character and a talking snail that does little but demonstrate that you're kind of a jerk.

All of Chronology's best ideas are left on the wayside for an experience that feels painfully typical. Puzzles are bland and extremely simple in construction, only ever becoming difficult do to the finicky interaction icon that makes it hard to discern what exactly you need to interact with, or the backgrounds which while beautiful tend to be hard to make out from objects in the foreground. Progression always felt tedious, puzzles slowing me down but providing no satisfaction to solve beyond the knowledge I'd never have to sluggishly make my way through them again.

There was a point when Chronology seemed promising, but it flounders around with its direction so long as to never feel cohesive or engaging. Its mechanics are disorganized, poorly implemented and rudimentary, and its narrative may as well not exist for as little substance as it has. The artwork is wonderful, but animations are choppy and the lack of vsync made for omnipresent screen tearing. It feels like a game formed in a puzzle platformer mold, with a handful of modifications having been made to differentiate it from the pack that probably did more harm than good in the long run.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131234621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1438617362}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038768193', 'num_games_owned': 1096, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1411810235}
review:
От Chronology вряд ли кто-то ждал чего-то особенного. Но слишком уж красиво выглядели скриншоты и чересчур вкусно звучали в аннотации «попытки исправить настоящее с помощью прошлого и будущего». В итоге же потенциально философская, довольно взрослая тема была безнадёжно потеряна плохим сценарием. Так для кого же этот проект? Не стоит держать интригу: он только для тех игроков, которым понравился художественный стиль по скриншотам. Однако вы видите «синюю» рекомендацию, потому что для семейного прохождения Хронология может сгодиться.

Вообще к игре уже с первых секунд можно задать несколько вопросов. Например, почему разработчики сделали игру абсолютно линейной. Даже укромных уголков или пасхалок здесь не найдёте (наверно, поэтому тут нет достижений). Какого-либо бонуса после прохождения игры тоже нет, так спрашивается: зачем делать головоломку, которую совершенно не имеет смысла перепроходить?

Проблемы тут и у сценария. В проекте, явно ориентированном на детскую аудиторию, создатели попытались придать серьёзности характеру Изобретателя. Получилось не ахти. Конечно, хорошо, что отношение главного героя к своему напарнику – Улитке – постоянно меняется, но, во-первых, хронометраж очень сжат, чтобы хорошо раскрыть характеры, а во-вторых, в игре ни разу не ставился акцент одновременно на двух персонажах: в начале игры во главу угла ставили Изобретателя, после середины – Улитку. Сразу оба они в центре внимания не были ни разу.

Их взаимоотношения – это тоже что-то с чем-то: как бы главный герой не относился к своей попутчице, она всегда будет глупо улыбаться и даже не попытается поддержать зарождающийся конфликт. Законами театра (о конфликтах) пренебрегать не стоит и в играх. Пример: Улитка достала Изобретателя болтовнёй. Тот на неё накричал, а ей как будто всё равно – стоит в стороне с глупой улыбкой. Ровно через одну головоломку Изобретатель её прощает (причём, в корыстных целях – она ему нужна, чтобы дальше пройти), и что бы вы думали? Прекратит Улитка болтать? Ничего подобного! Во второй части игры Улитка рассказывает о своём нелёгком прошлом. Истории действительно неплохие, даже пробирающие, но! Неужели нельзя было нарисовать её мордочку в это время огорчённой, напуганной, разозлённой – какой угодно другой, только без идиотской улыбочки? Хотя, о чём это я, - у неё нет даже анимации движения влево по экрану – влево она ползёт задом! А интерактивные объекты анимированы вполне себе неплохо: может, стоило поставить акцент на главных героях в вопросе анимации?

Головоломки в принципе неплохи и логичны, но с сюжетом не связаны никак. В той же Botanicula во время прохождения игрок нередко сам решает: помочь второстепенному персонажу или проигнорировать. Это давало приятнейшее ощущение, которое чувствуешь, когда кому-то искренне помог. В Chronology помощь не вызывает ровным счётом никаких эмоций. Даже забавные гуканья немногочисленных встречных незнакомцев не особо радуют. Также накладываются нелепые ограничения в головоломках, вроде невозможности позвать улитку просто потому что.

У игры четыре явных плюса: забавный визуальный стиль, хорошая музыка (хотя и без откровений), её скромная цена и короткая продолжительность, из-за которой она не успевает надоесть. В минусы же записывается всё остальное: скомканный, никакущий финал, ничтожно малое количество задач, слабый, клишированный сюжет, хотя рассказать о фишках со временем и последствиях решений можно было бы много и обстоятельно. На ум приходит Bastion с одной из главных тем сюжета: последствия принятых решений и невозможность избежать того, что зависит от человечества в целом. Ничего даже близкого к этому в Хронологии нет.

Хотя все претензии к сюжету, продолжительности и головоломкам беспочвенны, если вспомнить, что проект явно ориентирован на аудиторию младшего возраста. Эта игра семейная, удовольствие от неё получат всё-таки дети, а не взрослые. Задачки потому и простые: родители если что подскажут, что нужно делать. Также игра подойдёт тем, кто ищет симпатичную игру с несложными, но всё же интересными головоломками. Другой аудитории игра, скорее всего, покажется излишне простой, короткой и имеющей слабый сюжет и не особо интересных персонажей. В любом случае, в жанре приключенческих сказок Хронология – абсолютно проходной проект.

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/7144698/]Подписывайтесь[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198065651420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1527218044}
review:
有创意，想到了Braid。流程太短，两三小时足以通关。谜题有的太简单，有的太坑爹
